Kay at concierge was so sweet and helpful to suggest fun things to do from the Biergarten to ice skating and the Top of the Standard! I felt like I could really be entertained in just one night. The staff overall were all lovely especially Zack who personally brought me my treats and Sam who I bugged on the phone several times and all those in housekeeping.And lastly Shawn was so helpful with storing and handling my luggage after my check out! He was friendly with great personable conversation and he even escorted me upstairs after I had forgotten something in my room. Overall the stay was beyond what I could imagine and that was because of the vision and work of Freddy and the rest of the team at the Standard. Brava! I really hope to return.Always True,Michael-Anthony

I went here with my boyfriend for his birthday. It was above and beyond. I was especially happy with a handful of employees (Regina, Kevin, Keebo, Erin, and phill) for making our stay so fun and relaxing.

I was very excited to stay at this iconic hotel but felt quite badly let down. It's the sort of hotel that makes you feel like they are doing you a favour by letting you stay - too cool for school kind of attitude. The staff in the restaurant and indeed the restaurant itself was great. The bar at the top was quite another story. If you want to sit down at any table in the bar you have to book - whether or not you are staying at the hotel - as their "members" get priority and even on a Sunday night when it was half-full and we wanted a 7pm table we were told we couldn't have one until 7.30 which was a bit odd. The rooms are small but clean, although there is no-where to put clothes, apart from 4 hangers - no drawers anywhere. We stayed with them for three nights, on our last night the lock on our door broke and we were forced to move rooms; no-ones fault, these things happen, and we were thrilled to be moved to one of the corner suites on the 6th floor, we had been in a small room on the 8th floor. The view from the suite wasn't nearly as good but the room was larger and had a great bath in it, all lovely you might think. The noise coming from the night-club on the top floor was just shocking in this different part of the hotel. We had boom, boom, boom until 4am so no sleep. I complained the following morning when we checked-out and they were kind enough to give us a small amount off the bill but even so, I don't think we will be returning. If someone were to ask me, I would suggest one night at this place is quite fun, it's a sexy hotel. I am baffled as to why anyone would take a child and I saw quite a few children which made me feel quite uncomfortable. In the lifts there are various videos being played, one of which was quite sexually explicit.

The Standard, High Line is our GO-TO place where my husband and I love to stay when we are in NYC. Although the service is always great and the rooms beautifully designed, last night they out did themselves! I came to check-in (with no reservation) at 11:30 pm, after locking myself out of my place. As a damsel in distress, JADE came to my rescue! Not only was she warm, kind and sympathetic, but she gave me the only room left, which was a suite at an exceptional price, even when she knew I had little choice. I was so grateful to her that she did not take advantage of my situation. She and the Standard have earned my loyalty and we simply, won't stay anywhere else from here on out! I highly recommend!! Also, Ideal location, perfect for walking the High Line and shopping in the Meatpacking. And the dining at The Standard and within The Meatpacking is the best in town. Stay here and have fun!!
user_name:
marisap630
New York City, New York

review_body: I was really looking forward to staying at Standard as many of my ex-colleagues and current ones used to stay here regularly a few years ago, it was quite popular. Rooms look tired and level of maintenance and cleaning is at challenging level (I found an old pair of ladies knickers in my room wardrobe...); facilities ok but little attention, ie. you’ll find towels in a gym but no water or place mats. Service in restaurant also pretty low level. Wouldn’t stay here again...

Whenever I'm in NY I have to stay at the Standard. This trip was especially wonderful because it was also my Birthday weekend! Very clean and stylish room and bathroom. Not only was my room comfortable, but the service was amazing. From check in to check out the staff were so sweet and attentive to me and my family. Most of all I appreciate Samantha for her care and hospitality. She gave me an upgrade! That really made my birthday special. Next time I visit New York there is no doubt where I will be resting my head.

AMAZING VIEWS!!! AMAZING STAFF!!!I cannot express what an amazing visit we had at The Standard HighLine. Terrell was phenomenal and we had the best room in the hotel,. Boom boom room is BEAUTIFUL! A BIG shout out and Thank you to this Perfect NYC Hotel. We will be BACK ⚡️❤️

Have stayed here a few times, most recent visit reviewed here. Was in town for one night, late arrival and very early departure to EWR the next morning. Bed was comfortable, view excellent. Room mostly fine - I knew it would be small, it's NYC. Issue was the next morning at 0400 when I tried to take a shower. The water handles were non functional - they just spun, no water would come out. I had to get to the airport to catch a flight, but it was a frustrating end to the stay. I mentioned it to the front desk upon departure, so hopefully the next guest doesn't have the same issue - just wish I hadn't! (The front desk asked why I hadn't called down about it and that they would have fixed it - given that they did fix a burned out light promptly the night before I believe them, but I didn't have the extra 5-10 min to spare that morning). Next visit I'll check the shower earlier!
user_name:
dc_audax
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Hi!!!! I know I’m a bit late writing this review but here goes... I surprised my husband for his birthday. We stayed in the Hudson Studio. The view was absolutely fabulous!!! I had surprises at various times during our trip. The concierges Kay, John, Erin, and Colleen ALL helped discreetly in preparing every detail and having it go so smoothly. They answered every question and request immediately. I had planned minor requests as hot chocolate to the luxurious in-room couples massages. It was as if we were in “Neverland”. We wanted time to stand still and indulge in every moment. We happened to stay while the weather was 50 degrees in JANUARY! (1/20-1/21)We walked mid-afternoon the High Line and brought back take out from Chelsea Market. Later in the evening we enjoyed what seemed to be privately ice skating at their rink and relaxing under their heated seating area. Of course we traded in our skates for dancing shoes and hit up Le Bain. The next morning we pampered ourselves with a delicious breakfast at the Grill. It truly was a remarkable overnight getaway. I am THANKFUL to the whole concierge team because without their knowledge and support, I would have been lost in making my husbands birthday a memorable one for years to come. I can not wait to slip away here again. Michelle Bogdanowich,Long Island

Always love staying at The Standard. Last night was my last night in NY before I moved LA. Colleen and John from the concierge team sent me my favorite tequila and Regina upgraded me to a beautiful room with an unbelievable, quintessential west side New York view! I really appreciate their care, attention and hospitality. Can't wait to come back and stay at my go-to spot.
user_name:
mirwin94
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed in the Hudson Suite and had great views over the Hudson. The Boom Boom room has amazing cocktails and great views over the city but book a table in advance. The Standard Grill is a great restaurant and we can definitely recommend the delicious steak. The staff at the Standard was absolutely fantastic and special thanks to John and Erin at the Concierge desk who made our stay very special.
user_name:
kkoenigshausen
New York City, New York

review_body: Enjoyed every aspect of my stay, from the room service frittata to the delightful staff.The young gentleman Niko, who checked me in, was especially helpful and courteous and made me feel right at home.I can't wait to come back and experience the nightclub and bars on the property.

Hadn't been back here for a while, and returned to find some friendly new faces, but was especially grateful for the familiar, openhearted welcome of the amazing front-office manager, Samantha, who is smart, knowledgable, endlessly cheerful, and just delightful to talk with. I was here to tackle a challenging work project. As always, Samantha made sure things were perfect every step of the way. This was a brief visit, yet relaxing, rejuvenating, and productive. Thank you Samantha for always making sure I'm happy and well cared for during my stay. You rock! Thanks Standard High Line for another great escape.

I have done few hotels in the area as I am coming for work every 3 months and I wS pleased in every way with my stay at the Standard: the room, the way it was nicely cleaned every morning, the view, the service, and although it has a great bar, the rooms were well isolated and quiet. The location is great in Meatpacking as well. So perfect stay.

A great couples hotel in a trendy part of town. Sits right on top of the start of the Highline walk and is relatively close to the subway. Facilities are good and staff attentive. Rooms clean (if slightly unconventional in layout) and the higher floors have amazing views across the Hudson River and downtown.

Our stay at the Standard was pleasant and clean, but we were confused as to why they accepted families. This is definitely a couples hotel; an ad that said "hook up, get naked", no room had more than a bed, and the shower was facing the bed and didn't have a curtain. Although it is an agreeably good hotel, it is definitely NOT for families and NOT for children. This was my first time staying in Meatpacking District, and it was a different experience but im not familiar with the area, so next time I'd go to a hotel around 50 St-60 St.

Great service and nice rooms. Restaurant next door Nice Matin is delightful. This is where we always stay -- we really like the neighborhood feel and close to subway line.We will be back soon. Great location.

Stay here often for business and have always loved it. But this trip my room key would never work for the elevator and tonight my last night here the front desk attendant took my keys and asked me to sit and wait while he disappeared for several minutes then came back and said oh did I take your keys and then disappeared again. I just wanted to get to my room and sleep! How is that so hard. Sad to see this happen with a brand/place I loved.

Like many trendy venues staffed by millennials, this hotel doesn’t measure up to the expectations set by its website and representations. HOWEVER, if you want some of the best views in New York City, go ahead and stay here just for the views. The rooms are tiny. The bathroom situation is odd and ill planned. For two people the rooms will be very crowded, but one person can manage alright. The neighborhood is “up & coming” and significant construction is going on all around the hotel. This can hinder one’s experience, but if you’re up for it then it could be fun to try this once.

After our 3rd stay at the Standard on a recent trip to NYC we can only say great things about this hotel.Having booked a corner suite the check in staff very kindly upgraded us to a fabulous Hudson Suite. Incredible room with 180 degree views of the magical surroundings.I can't thank and promote this place enough.A special thank you to Nico and Jermaine who handled our every request with style and efficiency . Great ambassadors for the hotel.Looking forward to our 4th stay

This is a cute West Village hotel. The rooms are tiny and the food is average. The location is ok. It is perfect for tourists. It is near the High Line and the West Side High Way. In the winter they open up a skating rink and in the summer they have a outdoor seating area. The service could be way better. All in all this is an ok hotel.
user_name:
beatrice1817
New York City, New York

review_body: Living in NY, I have never stayed at the hotel, but the bar is NOT TO BE MISSED. outstanding views have me come back everytime I have visitors, and we are never disappointed. The bar is gorgeous itself. Very Pricey but very much worth it!

From our greeting at the front desk, complete with dog treats for our little 5 lb toy poodle-Dominique, to walking into our spectacular room, the stay was off the charts. The room was more stunning in person and arriving shortly before Sunset, made it all the more spectacular. The hotel staff couldn't have been friendlier and even the guests were welcoming, dinner at the Standard Grill is a must. The food remarkable staples and the service superb. PS, try the Martinis, you won't be disappointed! And the rooftop bar is a must see to behold. The views are one of a kind!

Great location, vibe and Interior - the bar and club at the top can be great at the right night. Nice outside terrace for drinks and food. Breakfast really good (but again - expensive). Just by the Highline - nice for a walk - and close to Chelsea Market.

I frequently travel from Miami to New York and consider the hotel a big part of the trip. The Standard Highline made this trip so much better.The room was modern but comfortable, and every amenity was provided. The open black shower was a unique experience, and the large windows offered great views of the river and the city. While on the highline, I discovered the view of the hotel is exciting as well....

Rooms are great, view is great, staff is friendly, restaurants and bars in hotel are great... just a great trip/hotel, etc. This was our second stay at this hotel and they are consistently good at what they do, and making sure the guest has a good stay. The building is well kept, well maintained, and is perfect for couples, families, or business travelers.

This could be a very cool hotel but sadly just missed the mark in so many ways. Firstly, the reception staff are very haughty and incredibly inept. Basic requests were met with disdain and then not completed correctly. The rooms are very average - the shower is useless, the layout irritating, no turndown service or complimentary water as a basic expectation. The restaurant is hit and miss at breakfast and overpriced when compared to far better options locally like The Spotted Pig or Soho House. Nonetheless, it is a great location but shouldn’t rest on its laurels as paces like Soho House offer much better alternatives.Wouldn’t stay again and only booked with a discount which definitely wasn’t worth it!!

Great trendy hotel in a good part of town. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Would highly recommend. Only downside was the attitude of the door staff going to the top floor night club, sadly their customer service does not reflect the great rest of the staffs approach.

I honestly do a lot of traveling throughout the year and have never been around such a caring staff than the ones at the Standard at High Line. John was sooooo amazing and absolutely managerial worthy. I felt very special all thanks to John and the amazing customer service at the High Line. Will be returning soon. Thanks again.

We booked three rooms for a family get-together. Overall, our experience was good. The staff was friendly and efficient; small problems were taken care of promptly. The food, service and ambience at the Grill were excellent, and prices were moderate. The buzzy, crowded scene here not exactly our game as two 80-year olds, but kind of fun for our younger family and us as well. The rooms were problematic, seemingly designed by a deranged midget. Bed so low it was not easy to rise; layout and fixtures in some bathrooms were bizarre. The clearance between spout and basin in our sink was less than 3 inches: impossible to fill a water glass, and I have bloody hands from trying to shave. (Not an exaggeration: Standard folk, check it out, room 611.) Our rooms were all quite small although mitigated by floor to ceiling windows and great Hudson River views (if you have one). Minimal storage for clothing, would not be great for a long stay. Location is perfect, away from the crowds of midtown but with plenty to do and fine restaurants close by. Whitney Museum and High Line next door. West Village sure has changed since we lived here 47 years ago.

You never know if a hotel will be as good the second time around as it was the first time you stayed. You know what to expect, you have seen what the hotel has to offer, etc. Our second stay far exceeded expectations!! Our check in process was one of the most pleasant experiences I have ever had with incredible customer service. The Top of the Standard was better than I remembered, and the Standard Grill was top notch. Last, if you can spring for the Hudson Suite, do it. I ended each night just taking in the most wonderful views from the floor to ceiling windows on three different walls of this room and a glass of champagne in the soaking tub gazing at the sunset over the Hudson is a must!! Thank you Standard for giving my wife and I another experience we will not soon forget.

We had such a wonderful time at The Standard Highline! Niko at the front desk really took care of us on our anniversary and made it special. We also had drinks at their club on the top floor which was the perfect way to end the night. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

My fiancé and I were coming here to celebrate our engagement, when we checked into the front desk come to find out we received a complimentary upgrade to a suite with sweeping views of the Empire State Building down to the Tribeca on a sold out NYE weekend, with a lovely note and a bottle of champagne. All the staff as been so courteous to us both during our stay and when I emailed the guest services agent Nikolas to thank the hotel. I got an immediate personal response. Seriously the best hotel stay I’ve ever had and I travel regularly for work. Seriously a special stay for a special moment in our lives. Will absolutely stay again for years to come.

Amazing views, take corner king room on high floor. When we arrived, we were given a lower floor, we asked to move up and they were happy to accommodate. Customer service was great. Fun and quirky vibe. Carpet in the room could use an update. In the meat packing district, great night life in the area.

The room itself is small like all manhattan hotels. It's a boutique hotel, so its very artsy and cultural when they offers art books for gagosian gallery and etc. The location is super convenient because the main reason of my trip was to check out galleries and the Bain. Melinda from the front desk was so helpful and sweet. She helped me picking the floor and gave me a lot of informations on local bars and lounges. Def come back!

I’ve always wanted to stay at this beautifully designed hotel. It looks so cool and majestic sitting there on the Highline in the Meatpacking district. I booked a corner room for about $732/night and insisted on a corner room with a tub. Service upon arriving at the hotel was sub par. Front desk staff was minimally helpful. Took elevator up to our high floor room. Hallways look cheap with rubber cove base running along the bottom of walls wear the carpet meets. Bright fluorescent lighting like in a dorm. Our room had the most amazing view. It was very small. Bed was comfy, but nightstands were flimsy and weak. Bathroom sink too shallow and small. Tub was nice and big. Great place to sit and look at the city and watch the snow fall. Great view of the Empire State Building. No complimentary coffee maker so you have to pay $16 to have them deliver 2 cups worth to your room. Room was tiny for the price which is ok with me but the quality in general was sub standard and everything looked a little worn out. Gym was fantastic with a great view of the river. The restaurants downstairs were great for young adults who want to see other young kids, but for my wife and I who are used to more sophistication we found it to be hectic and kind of like a college hangout. The hotel feels like it’s run by a bunch of college kids. I don’t think I will stay here again. Had to try it but not worth the price in my opinion. The club upstairs was super cool but again lacking in service.

Stayed @ the Standard because my husband's Xmas party was across the street @ Valbella. When the cab dropped us off, we weren't sure where the entrance was due to fencing all around. Not the most welcoming greeting, but we checked was quick & we went up to our room. Very cool & modern, lobby could use a little refreshing. Room was very trendy, typical size for NY. Awesome bathtub, but not the stand alone tub we requested. View from the room was amazing. water-closet, no fan. Shower/sink/bathtub all in 1 room with no door. No trash can either. 1 minor flaw, no soap, just shower gel (even for your hands) that smelled strongly of dryer sheets or men's cologne. Very strong. Almost offensive. Great bluetooth speaker by bed. small dinette. Great room service. Wish there was a guide to the hotel in the room. We weren't sure where the "cool" bar was, where breakfast was served that came with our package or where restaurant was located. We asked & explored. We still don't know what was in the basement! Cool french restaurant in front of hotel & a very cozy restaurant inside. Decorated for the holidays. The expense of the lighting in the hotel must be incredible! Small Skating rink out front. Breakfast was very good & service was quick, warm & friendly. Would love to go back when the weather was warm to walk the Highline.You are in the meat-packing district, so you'll need to take a cab to mid-town if desired. Our room over-looked it.

For my very first visit to NYC, my fiance and I picked the Standard because a friend works for the hotel. The hotel itself is very artsy and intriguing and I loved that about it. Check-in went smoothly. I was prepared for a small room as my fiance warned me that it's NYC and not to expect much, so the room was understandably smaller than what I am used to. The room was decorated nicely and with such a small space, I can understand the configuration of the shower/vanity/toilet. The view was pretty, etc. etc. Our room was on the 9th floor and we could hear the club in the hotel, though it was just a dull bass, nothing necessarily to keep me up with earplugs in (provided by the hotel). But my BIGGEST complaint was on the night of my 30th birthday, a Friday night, when we tried to go to the 18th floor bar and the doorman told us that it was for MEMBERS ONLY and sent us away. Guests of the hotel get sent away from an empty club?! The concierge then told us we could go to La Bain BUT it would be doorman's discretion whether or not we could get in? Like, are we not pretty enough or fancy enough? "Luckily " we were allowed in to La Bain, which was 100% empty at 11 pm on a Friday night. From that point, we didn't even try to drink or dine anywhere at The Standard.

Even though I Live in New york, Hotels are my sweet spots as I enjoy doing the usual StayCations here and there and within New York, there are many superb hotels to choose from. We stayed at the Standard Highline this past weekend and was extremely satisfied with the overall experience.Samantha, from Front Desk needs to be highlighted. From the first moment I set foot into the The standard, she already gave me such a great first impression with her positive and energetic attitude. The check in process was seamless and fast.She went above and beyond to make my Birthday stay at the standard one of the best times I've had in a Hotel in the city and I can't thank her enough. She put me in a room with breathtaking views and the room was more then what I expected.The room itself was great. We booked the Hudson Studio. It was spacious , clean and the layout was perfect. The views overlooking the west side was simply gorgeous and the freestanding Bathtub looking out into the hudson was the reason why we booked the room in the first place. It did not disappoint.The hotel environment is typical meat packing, fashionable energetic.Everything is within walking distance and we ended the night at Le Bain and had a blast.I will surely be back.
user_name:
Sean I
New York City, New York

review_body: Have had 2 great stays at the hotel in late november 2017. Both had easy checkin, accomodating conceirge to a last minute saturday night group dinner reservation for 8-10 (would have been IMPOSSIBLE without them!) and Jay and David running the front desk completely took care of me. will come back again, and again and again.

Great hotel! Excellent front of house staff. Especially Kaheen and Erin who went above and beyond to assist in a calm and friendly way. Spacious rooms, well maintained. Perfect location. Easy walk to great restaurants - fast links uptown. Highly recommended.

Stayed here this past weekend and everything was great! Samantha from the front desk was so helpful and friendly. She was so knowledgeable and gave my boyfriend and I great ideas on what to do in the area. The view from our room was unbelievable. Can’t wait to stay here again!!

Samantha who helped me and my friends check in was lovely, made us feel so welcome, and went above and beyond what I was expecting. This hotel is my favorite - for a night out for my friend's birthday, we had everything we needed in one spot to celebrate.

I came into town with some of my girls and we ended up being accommodated by an employee named Jade. She was a total sweetheart & treated us like she was one of our longtime homegirls. She knows all about the hottest bars & clubs. We ended up going to PHD Dream one night bc of her recommendation & the only club open that night. When we got back the next day, my friend Kathleen & I went looking for Jade. She listened to the story of our crazy night ! The best staff members are the natives ! Thanks Jade !

SHL is my favorite place in NYC. The hotel location is the hottest spot in town, walking distance have everything you need and want. The hotel staff are very helpful, any requests, don't free to ask them! They will do the best to help and coordinate with your request. I love their SHL pre arrival team, and SHL Guest Service team, especially David B.. Extremely helpful and friendly, and helped my every time during my stay!I keep coming back to this hotel whenever I am in NYC, and have stayed there 13 times in 2017.

I have been to the standard high line 4-6 times over the last few years. Each time the service was reduced and it has finally crossed into totally unacceptable,I visited the standard high line dec 8-10. Arrived early evening (6:30) and no one was available to help with bags etc. The checkin went fine but I was informed that the top of the standard (rooftop bar and restaurant) would be closed for private use all three nights. Come on, if you had told me at time of the reservations, I certainly would have looked elsewhere. One of the nice things about this location is the rooftop restaurant.Next, the hot water in the rooms disappeared for two nights. It is tough to take cold showers and shave with cold water. WTF.Finally, to add to my misery, on Sat. night the Le Bain rooftop club got so loud it woke me up at 2:00am and it went on until well after 4:00am.This level of service is totally unacceptable and I will not return to this location.

The location is perfect, the rooms are great and the views wonderful. I'd stayed a lot on business but this was the first time I'd visited with my wife for a couple of nights away without the kids. The concierge, Kay really looked after us and made our stay extra special. The way he, and the staff are so genuinely friendly and go out of their way to take care of you makes it a really unique place.

I stay at the Standard Highline several times a year for work and for vacation, and it's consistently a great experience. The views are impossible to beat, the rooms are well designed, beds are comfortable, and the upstairs bars and downstairs restaurants offer great variety.Regina in particular is incredibly helpful and always adds a personal level of service to every stay which is very appreciated. I look forward to visiting again soon!

The views are stunning. The people are interesting. The restaurants are cozy and tasty. The top of the standard is probably the best lounge bar I’ve ever been to. And the staff is so accommodating. Regina and her team at the front desk are so helpful and always take care of me. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else!Use the one night app to get great last minute deals here.

Located in the Chelsea district with a minute walk to the Highline and a 5 minute walk to the subway, The Standard is a unique trendy experience. The staff are very courteous and helpful, the rooms are clean and tou can ask for a view of the Hudson River. Their meeting rooms are great (well, I spent time looking out the windows at the walkers on the Highline and boaters on the Hudson River. The only issue I had was that occasionally only two of four elevators were open to the public--which made for a wait! But overall I love the location, the food, the trendy atmosphere and did I mention the food (again)? The pictures are all views from my window, except the wedding ceremony we witnessed from our walk to the Highline.

I loved this rooftop bar! The views & design were spectacular. Also loved their huge selection of cocktails (see photo of their bar wall). It is pricey, but so loved every second there. Was TOTALLY worth it!P.S. the bathrooms are really interesting too. You must not miss that experience, it is trippy.

Hipster hotel in the perfect meatpacking location. Also very convenient to Google NYC HQ. Rooms are typically small for this type of hip hotel but the use of mirrors, low beds and floor to ceiling windows create a sense of more space. Views are great. Bed, sheets, and bathroom amenities are first rate. For big spender foodies the location is close to Del Posto. Also close to Chelsea market for lots of other eating experiences. Staff is well-trained, intelligent and accommodating. Some of the funkiest fun elevators of all time.

After 5 years of living in NYC, I decided to stay at the Standard High Line for my last night in the city. It’s a luxurious experience staying at the Standard and for the price, its a very reasonable option. Especially considering the quality of service, amenities and hospitality. The floor to ceiling windows, the comfortable beds, the quality of food, the bars, restaurants and access to NYC’s Meatpacking District and High Line are all part of the reason why I truly love this hotel. You won’t have a bad stay and you won’t feel like a pretentious knob doing it. Big shout out to Erin Reifsynder at the concierge who went out of her way to ensure our last night was truly memorable.

My husband and I have frequented The Standard High Line many times over the past few years and always have had a terrific stay. The Staff is courteous and friendly and the rooms are all spectacular!!! We love the location, great restaurants, shopping and nightlife. We always feel like we are on vacation even if it is just an overnight stay. Can't rave enough about this hotel and staff!! It is very hip and trendy. We always choose this location when we come into NYC. Even the brunch menu is fantastic!!!

I give 5 stars to this amazing hotel. Stayed here for the weekend and had a wonderful vacation. Our room had the best view and the staff was so nice especially Regina, she took such good care of us. I will definitely come back soon

Our experience at The Standard was incredible from start to finish. Samantha at the front desk was very helpful & recommended that we make reservations for bingo at the Standard Grille. To our pleasant surprise, it was a lively party coupled with alcoholic prizes. Our room was nothing short of breathtaking, surrounded by windows and overlooking a gorgeous view of the water. The room is very open format so do not expect privacy but it's definitely great for couples. I had a blast and look forward to going back :)

Recently stayed at the standard for the second time. Love this place! Such a fun and cool concept and awesome design. All the bars and restaurants and rooftop lounges are beautiful and have a great vibe. The rooms are so comfortable and all have amazing floor to ceiling windows for an amazing view of the city. The staff is young and super friendly, especially Samantha at the front desk was super attentive and helpful. We'll be back!!!

I recently returned to The Standard, High Line for a 2nd time and they did not disappoint. Samantha at the front desk was lovely and accommodating and checked us in with all smiles. We enjoyed the amazing river views and suppppeerrrr comfy bed. At night we were directly to The Standard Grill for Bingo- and it’s not your average Bingo! DJ, singing and drinking annddd fun is all required. Thanks again Standard.
user_name:
robix18
New York City, New York

review_body: I went to The Standard like I normally do when I visit NYC and had the best experience I've had in a while. Not only was the food amazing but I met this intelligent, witty girl by the name of Jade. She was attentive and a comedian of sorts if I may say so myself. She even was knowledgable about stuff outside of the restaurant and pointed me in the direction of a good time. Definitely going back for some more advice !
user_name:
aprilfosterlove
New York City, New York

review_body: We were told to visit the standard rooftop bar by many friends. Unfortunately due to the weather and time of year the outdoor rooftop was closed. The view from inside though was nothing short of incredible and we didn’t even mind the outdoor rooftop was closed. We sat in the warmth in extreme comfort, sipping cocktails and watching the sunset. We arrived just as it opened at 4pm and got a seat right by the window on a Monday evening. By 6pm it was packed, we couldn’t believe how lucky we were to get a table right by the window. The place is extremely posh and a bit snobby. Make sure to dress nicely for the occasion. They make you check in your coats and bags and you can’t take a camera in only your phone. A strand tip but a MUST DO: the bathrooms at the standard bar have the best view of nyc I’ve ever seen. Be sure to visit the toilets and sit there in awe of the view. Every friend of mine whose visited has suggested looking at the toilet view - strange but go and you won’t be disappointed.

Loved my stay at the standard. My fav was the great staff that works there. They really do go out to provide you a great stay. Only con was the noise. Pipes are really loud, and could strongly hear each time my neighbours used the bathroom. Also I´d recommend not to get a room on the top floors. Even though the view is amazing, the noise from Le bain can be annoying on weekends.

This hotel is smart, sexy and sophisticated. I would truly describe it as a functional piece of art. The service was excellent! I found the staff to be extremely attentive, professional, and pleasant. They went above and beyond to assure our comfort. When I first walked into our room excitement came over me. It was beautifully designed, comfortable, clean and totally hip. During the day we walked the highland, visited the Whitney museum and had the opportunity to check out local artists and shops. I was especially thankful for the kind and informative front desk staff. Niko, in particular, was amazing! He gave us some great suggestions for exactly what we were looking for. We had a blast while we were there! Definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed at in a long time! I very much appreciate the memorable experience! Thank You!

Amazing stay. I was visiting family with my wife and decided to stay out one night in the city. We decided on the Standard because we wanted drinks on their bar up top. At check-in, Diede was quick and informative but gave us the bad news and told us the bar up top was closed due to a private event but she quickly referred me to Colleen their concierge. In no time she referred me to two other rooftops in the area. There is a funky video in the elevator and the room was gorgeous! A little tight on space but which NYC hotel isn't. The bathtub was a little clunky but we are more shower people anyway so it was okay. At checkout, Kevin at the front desk even reminded me I had my home keys which I hadn't and had left in my room. I will definitely come back again not only for the hotel but the service as well!

Best hotel in NYC with amazing conciergeColleen Burst and Erin Reifsnyder and John Bajana just fixed us the best tips for NYC from the concierge. Best I have ever beep up to by service Global. Put Your weekend in their hands and U will never regret it.

My (now) fiancee and I spent two and a half weeks at the Standard High Line from the end of August 2017 and had the absolute trip of a lifetime. By way of background, we are from Sydney Australia, in our late 20's / early 30's and like to eat, drink (and she likes to shop).The hotel itself was fantastic - unbeatable location, but more on that later.What really made our trip, the trip of a lifetime, was the the concierge team at the hotel who were absolutely amazing. I planned my engagement in our suite with them and they were unbelievably helpful. Months before I'd even checked in, they were providing me with assistance on everything from booking helicopters, getting helium balloons, champagne and rose petals organised for our room, arranging hire cars and reserving tables at restaurants and bars for us. They put together the most memorable engagement I could have ever hoped for (I'm certain that it helped get my fiancee over the line to say "yes"). Throughout our stay they continued to bend over backwards to help us get reservations at amazing restaurants, front row seats at fashion week shows and even an impossible-to-get private VIP tattoo booking with JonBoy during fashion week.To Erin, thank you for being our personal concierge for the time we stayed and to the rest of the concierge team, Colleen, John and Kaheen, we cannot thank you enough for going out of your way for us and making our trip so memorable. We truly felt like we were part of the family by the time we left.Now to the hotel itself. You couldn't ask for a better location - right in the middle of the action in meatpacking, and easy to get up to mid-down, up-down and down to lower Manhattan. There are an abundance of great venues to eat and drink at both within and around the hotel - The Standard Grill, in particular, is fantastic.The rooms are fantastic. We upgraded to a Hudson Studio Suite which I understand are the most popular suites. We felt like we were right on the Hudson river, with floor to ceiling windows on three sides of the room, we had views up and down the entire river, all the way to the Statue of Liberty.Cannot recommend highly enough - the only place to stay in the city.We will be back, hopefully sooner rather than later!

I was a guest at this hotel from Nov, 5th through Nov 11th. It was my 12th time at this hotel. Prior to this stay, I was there for 10 days in September, 2017. I’ve been seen the decline in the service of this hotel, but nothing was compared to this last time. The problems started from begging, since I have booked a room with river view and ended up in a room with no river view. The explanation at the check in was that the hotel was very busy and the only rooms left were without river view, without options, I accepted. There were nobody to help me with my bags, the hall was chaotic (I check in around 9PM). I thought that would be my only problems, but I was very wrong. From the start the heating didn’t work, I tried calling but after 45 minutes trying and no answer I had to go downstairs to ask someone to fix it. Since I was late they said they would send someone the next day. Next day came nobody showed and I called again. This time someone came and fixed the problem, only for it to malfunction the next day again. In my forth day after many visits from maintenance the problem was solved. But there were far worse problems. Every single day that I left the hotel at night, even at 7PM, there were people selling drugs openly in front of the hotel entrance, they even approached us offering all kinds of drugs. Every time that happened we informed hotel security and front desk, they asked us who were doing, we showed, and surprised, they did nothing, because we stayed close to see what happened and, not once, someone approached them, or told the to leave, or called the police, NOT ONCE. When it happened while we were coming back to the hotel we looked from the window to see if the hotel would take any action, but hours would go by and the hotel did absolutely nothing. I have never witnessed it before, but this time there were construction next to the entrance of the night club and the dealers changed their place (that was said very calmly from a lady in the check in counter). I really don’t want to stay in a hotel that believes this kind of things are normal. Coming and going from the hotel felt very insecure, but nobody cared. But the icing on the cake happened on Saturday (Nov, 11th). Since our flight was late at night, I paid the room until November, 12th, but for some reason I don’t know the hotel system had our check out date at November, 11th. We left the room to lunch and when we came back our keys were not working, so we went to the check in counter again, a very aggressive man told us that the keys were not working because we were supposed to have left at 12PM and it was 2PM. He went on to say how we were causing trouble to the guests that were going to occupy our room, since they had already arrived to the hotel and were waiting for us to vacate the room. We explained that our reservation was for the check out on November, 12th, he doubted and we showed the reservation. He asked for a minute, took my phone to his manager and came back saying we were right ang gave us new key. No apologies, no sympathy, nothing, gave the keys, said the day was busy and asked us to go. We left the hotel and came back to pick up our luggage and go to the airport. The keys, again, didn’t work, but, at least, this time, they gave us the key without complaint. We trying calling someone to pick up our luggage but once again nobody picked the phone at front desk or luggage. My boyfriend went downstairs and asked someone to pick it up. I was in the room when the guy came. He came with no cart. I said that he could pick up the luggage e take it downstairs, but I would stay at the room because I was had some things to do. He pretended that he didn’t listen to me, entered the room, put all my luggage in the hallway, the lady from housekeeping that was knocking on the door every 5 minutes even with the do not disturb sigh the door entered the room, the guy went through all the things inside the room and basically kicked me out of the room. He radio someone saying that the problem was solved, that front desk could tell the guests waiting for the room that it would be ready in 10 minutes. I payed for that night, I had the right to stay. It was 3PM. It was disrespectful and unacceptable. Since I was kicked out I went to the check in counter to check out and informed what had just happened. The lady said she would inform her superior and see if it was possible not to charge me for the extra night I payed, but could not use. She explained that the hotel was very busy because there were lots of events at the hotel that day. And that is a guest problem why? If you don’t have the capacity to do that many events at once, don’t do it. Once we check out we had to wait almost 1 hour to have our luggage. The luggage carts were there, but there were no one to carry it. We offered to pick up the bags (that stayed more than 1h in the hallway pf the 12th floor), but they informed us we couldn’t use the cart. So we waited. In the check out we were promised that everything we said were going to be passed on to the superiors and the hotel was going to contact us. I waited more than a week, and nothing came. I am really disappointed and pretty sure I won’t stay at The Standard a 13th time.

Its a fun hotel - stayed for 4 nights, I think better as a couple than as a single traveller - an exhibitionist's delight if you want! Rooms are comfortable and I had a great view to the South West over the Hudson and lower Manhatten - the bed was very comfortable, but the pillows less so, on the one occasion I did not bring my own pillow from home, I regretted it. The only gripes I have are minor - the strange lack of a bin! The headboard is not permanently attached to the rail above the bed so I knocked it off at 3am and thought what the hell it that on my face... soon sorted and most annoyingly the whistling sound caused by a gap at the bottom of the door into the corridor - soon sorted with floor towel stuffed against it. Shower a big head, hot water very quick to appear and the shower big enough for 2 or more friendly people... and very soft large towels...The bar is cool and has great views, the cafe/grill has a good menu and attentive staff without being irritating, and I really like the floor made up of bonded copper and back painted 1c coins and as my flight was late out of Newark I asked for a late check out 5pm for a fee of course but worth it, the video playing in the life is a bit surreal and disturbing and funny at the same time...Its certainly quieter there than at the Maritime I've also stayed less noise of honking traffic - seriously taxi drivers in NY think that if you pause for a nanosecond after the lights change you should get honked even at 2am.... would I stay again - yes, got a good deal staying via British Airways with a flight and hotel deal

I reached out directly to The Standard 24 hours ago and guess what, no response. This sums up my experience there in a nut shell. No one that works at The Standard Highline knows what is going on. There is zero effort to make your stay a pleasant one and to make you feel like you are a valued customer. I live in the NY area and just wanted to get away for a night with my wife. I had several people give me a heads up and I should have listened. The Biergarten is great and the food at The Standard Grill is good, not great. I did not have issue with the amenities like some people. But the service and customer facing staff were just awful. Front both people at the front desk checking me in and somehow turning our 2 bags into a 30 min journey to our room, to not knowing when the biergarten is open, to our waitress in the restaurant. The whole experience was just a test of patience. I'm still waiting for some type of response.
user_name:
madigan516
New York City, New York

review_body: It was a disappointment given the price. I have stayed many times in meatpacking and you get much better value for money elsewhere. Great views from the rooms, but rooms need an upgrade. Nice gym with great view. Nice bar on 18th floor with fabulous view. However, we didn’t feel welcome when arriving at the bar despite being guests at the hotel. A bit arrogant welcome.

The hotel bedrooms are small, cramped and dated and value/prize is way off - probably carried by their hyped restaurants and bar. And they are nice - the Top of Standard Bar in fact excellent. The Bar staff excellently attentive and well casted. The views are unforgettable.

This ultra trendy spot did not seem worth the price or the hype. The elevators are crowded with people going up to the rooftop club, and they are so dark that it is impossible to find where to put in the key so that you can select a hotel floor. Security seems suboptimal too, as any of said party goers can follow you off the elevator. The rooms are small and outdated and a little stark. The upstairs club vibrates the whole building well into the early hours, and the staff at the door are not very friendly to hotel customers just wanting to have a drink before going out. On the plus side, the views were amazing, the location is great, and the breakfast restaurant was a perfect spot. But I am going back to the Maritime next time I am down that way.

I understand it's in NYC and the rooms would be tiny for ~$600 a night ($519 room and approximately $80 in taxes and fees). For some reason, I wasn't as impressed with this place as I thought I'd be. . . the carpets throughout the hotel, including the lobby and at the Top of the Standard, all needed a cleaning. While the rooms were tidy, I didn't get that "clean" feeling. Some of the furniture in the rooms, lobby, terrace, etc. looked dingy, scuffed and worn. I'm sure if the place wasn't so dark, you could actually see the dirt.While the toilet is in a separate area with a door, the sink, shower and tub are all one. When taking a shower, the floor in front of the sink will be wet. Since I needed to dry my hair, I threw towels on the floor because since the plug for the hair dryer kept coming out of the socket (everything plugged in to this socket would hang or come out). Bottomline, cool to be in a trendy place in NYC and say "been there, don't that", but definitely not worth more stars than 3 -> the place is just standard

A truly enjoyable experience. Great Hudson river and lower Manhattan view from the 16th floor. Love the modern room. The bed was so comfortable, I slept like a baby and woke so rested. Friendly staff. Would definitely come back:)

Very trendy hotel in the heart of the just as trendy meat packing district. It seemed that every step I took in the hotel had some unique feature to it, from the lobby sleek chairs and mini dressed front desk agents to the dark elevator with Moulin Rouge like video feed playing in it to the individual room with floor to ceiling windows and shower stall visible to all (just keep the main curtains closed when you're taking a shower). I loved it! Their gym near the top floor had amazing views with plenty of equipment (just wish there were fans in the room). Room service had excellent food with good service. Very easy access to the High Line and a short walk to Chelseas Market. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to stay somewhere fun.

This hotel is in one of the best positions in Manhattan and has first class staff. It is deceptive in that the web advertised room we booked simply didn’t exist. We are retired, touring “Grey nomads” and found the extremely cramped, poorly laid out room quite unsuitable for a stay of more than a night.Bed was jammed against the wall on two sides, was as low as a Futon, and very difficult to get in and out of. Bathroom layout was quite bazaar.The toilet “cubicle” was an exercise in space saving at the expense of usability. Very trendy for the young executive traveler who will trade comfort for style.

Very efficient & helpful staff, especially Colleen.Beautiful corner room.Had to wait 1 hr for the room due to a table repair in progress, but well taken care of with drinks & snacks.Strongly recommended!

Thanks mostly to Colleen B, got an especially great room with city views. Great stay, great occasion. Colleen is the best, very helpful and professional. And High Line Standard, what's not to like?Eric L

holiday weekends in the city are almost hit or miss when it comes to a crowded area and business. The reservation team on the phone were all far more reliable and knowledgeable than neighbouring hotels since I was looking for something fairly specific. This last minute stay in the city was almost too short of notice for the holiday weekend but the team made sure to get me in and with everything I was looking for ( even bubbles ). While I have stayed in a lot of NYC hotels this one was the most attentive a good example being they called up to the room to let me know we left a wrapped present in the back seat of our car to make sure we didn't need it. Room was spotless when we showed up ( mirrors in the bathroom always are a good example ) room was dust and scent free. the open bathroom is different but we actually really enjoyed it since the view was one of the most important parts of the stay. Snack cabinet and bar are one of the best of seen they even carry a shave kit for that last minute trip. location is perfect if your looking for top rated dinners and a good place to party after( old homestead was our choice ). The valet was faster than most and they walked my GF out with an umbrella and put our bags in the trunk ( can you believe the valet then tried to run away before I could tip?) all in all it was an incredible stay and with all of the competition in the city for the hotel industry its hard to promise to be back to one place but we can guarantee we will be back for plenty more stays! thank you to hotel management for properly training your staff.

The accommodations are above average. We had a great view from the 16th floor of the Empire State building. We loved being able to jump on the High Line for a morning exercise walk. Good neighborhood restaurants and shopping. It was a bit confusing to figure out access to the Top of the Standard - The Boom Boom room.

This was the 2nd time in the Standard. The price was reasonable fair for the quality. The rooms are very comfortable designed and we loved the view from the 17th floor over NYC. The room was very clean and many toilettories where very good. We had a cocktail at the Boom-Boom room what was also designed very well. We met some nice people on the bar. The only negative thing for hotel guest is that you can't use the elavator after 21 PM anymore to go your room. So when you need to take your cote you need to go down walk out the door and take the elevator again to go up. Also with the stairs they don't allow you althought it is only two floors down. This didn't felt hospital at all. This is also the reason why I rated 4 stars instead op 5.

We stayed at one of the Corner King rooms (1023), which was just perfect in virtually every respect. Everything that you may have read about The Standard is probably true. You have to be prepared to be on full display with the floor to ceiling windows, but in return you have a sun-filled room with spectacular views. Our Room was at the end of the Corridor facing the Hudson, so we had perfect exposure to the north, south, and east. The room is VERY open style, but works perfectly for two. It's well worth spending the extra money for a somewhat larger room -- by New York standards, ours was definitely on the larger side. It was great to be high enough so that we did not have an obstructed view, but were still tantalizingly low to be able to look down onto the pedestrians walking the Highline. Yes, that includes from the bathroom. The amenities are all super cozy and the room service had excellent choices. Depending on what view you're looking for, you may want to be quite specific when booking a room. We had a clear view of the World Trade Center, but that came at the expense of being able to look up toward mid-town. The sunsets made more than up for it, and if you really want to enjoy to nighttime views of the Empire State Building, make sure to have a reservation at the Top of the Standard (another review). The service was great and the variety of restaurants was excellent. Will definitely be back!
user_name:
francescademont
New York City, New York

review_body: Stopped in after seeing the patio/restaurant from the high line walk way. Seemed inviting and cozy area to stop in for a drink. The ambiance is nice and they had blankets for every chair so you could keep warm while enjoying a cocktail. Nice place to have a cocktail.

Let me preface my remarks by saying, I lived in Manhattan & have stayed in many hotels in NYC. So, I am used to NYC hotels. Some good, some not so good. never awful, till now. This one, I wanted to try. but, I will not return. First, when we arrived, Couldn't find the front door, Circled twice before I saw it. My wife had to go into the hotel to get someone to valet my car. Check in was quick and easy. The room (1420) was small, even for NY standards. Absolutely no where to put our bag. European style bed, Very low, otherwise, ok. I paid for a deluxe queen. I was looking on their website. The room they pictured was not what I was in. Called down and was told the deluxe queen and the standard queen are the same room, The deluxe queen is just a higher floor. Which, being a NYer and staying in many NY hotels, I knew that was better, Less white noise from the city below. I was wrong! (we'll get back to that). Went to the rooftop bar in the late afternoon for drinks, Was nice, great views. very overpriced drinks. Spoke to a nice woman there, told her we would come back after dinner. She said the bar would be closed for a private event. Really? I've never stayed in a hotel that closes it's bar to it's guests. However, she did give us a card and said to email them, Make a reservation and we could come back. So, I did. I got an email back asking what time we were returning, Said 10ish. Got another email back saying. Can you come earlier, we close at 7:30. Again, Seriously? Gave up, went to a bar outside the hotel. Finally got back to our room, on the 14th floor. (up high, quieter, so i thought). we were awoken by this intense pounding. Which, being a former club DJ myself. I knew exactly what it was. And it was loud! Very loud! and the club was 4 floors above us. Couldn't even imagine what it was like in the club. We tried to ignore it. But, no way. Called down and complained. Told, Matt (I think). Either get it turned down or be prepared to comp my room. I swear it got louder after that call. Needless to say, I was pissed! Got up, dressed, went down to the lobby. Spoke to a manager. He must have know who I was. First words out of his mouth was, "We'll comp your night". Which they did. After he said that. I told him, you need to turn it down. Which it appeared they did. But, It still kept us up until around 3-3:30AM when it finally stopped. It was an unfortunate situation all around. They do not cater to their guests like other NYC hotels. The staff seemed very nice. Room was clean, tiny, but clean. Weird set up. Toilet is literally in a closet. shower tub and sink all in one room. but, not partitioned. water gets everywhere. Needless to say, i will not be returning. I recommend going to the W. Love those hotels. Oh, and FYI. The Standard website says $65.00 to valet the car. It was $85.00 for one night. But, at that point, I wasn't going to argue. just wanted to leave. Unless you plan on partying till 4 am, I would find another hotel.

I’ve been for drinks at the Top of the Standard (drinks really pricey but incredible views!) and dinner in the Bar & Grill - all absolutely worth it! Would highly recommend in an evening but also great during the day after a walk along The Highline.

He came, he saw, he stayed and this is how it went down....If Manhattan’s ultra-trendy Meatpacking District had a ground zero it would probably be The Standard Hotel. Sitting at the nexus of hip LA style and NY glam this intriguing and inspiring destination attracts a mash up of the cool and wanna be cool, all seeking a slice of the high life on the high line.Upon arrival, there is an instant star quality to the lobby with its large yellow revolving doors and endless stream of posing guests and visitors. The guest suites, while not big (this is Manhattan) are intimate with quirky, Mid Century inspired interiors by Roman and Williams, and feature exposed showers and floor to ceiling windows - this is definitely not a stuffy business hotel unless you're in the business of fun, romance or exhibitionism. One can only imagine the stories that these walls could tell!In the King Deluxe Suite, the rich use of wood creates a warm and Scandinavian feeling to the curved and restrained interiors that feature some nicely contrasting black and white details. It is black that pervades most of the wet areas of the bathroom room with the said black tiles making the shower impossibly dark. Given its revealing nature this is no doubt purposeful, so too the complimentary prophylactics. The room is appointed in way that says you're here to stay for a good time and not necessarily a long time, but if you're stay is more than a one nighter (which is a must) you'll be more than pleased to see a healthy array of bar snacks, sweets, drinks, socks, a scented candle, blue-tooth speaker, earphones and a host of bespoke toiletries, along with a book of short stories - all ensuring that you are prepared for whatever the Meat Packing District can throw at you.As far as local attractions, the list really is endless. Of course there's the High Line directly below which takes you all the way to the Hudson Train Yards which makes for a beautiful early morning walk. There's the Chelsea Market, Whitney Museum of Art, boutique fashion stores galore and more food options than you can imagine - from Dos Caminos to Catch, The Red Cat and Scarpetta to name but a few.In the end, The Standard is a kaleidoscope of a venue offering a cheeky, irreverent and fun filled platform to explore and consume Manhattan to the fullest. If you would like to read even more and see some extra images then please jump over to akala.ae thanks for reading!

I stayed at the Standard for 6 nights attending Adweek during September. It's been my first time to NY so I can't really compare this hotel to others in the city but I really had a wonderful experience. Everything at this hotel is different starting from the elevator (although too dark I could barely see the room key). They have a top notch rooftop overlooking Manhattan. The room is just about the right size and has everything available, I didn't have to order a single item from the room service. Overall, a wonderful experience and highly recommended whether you are on business or leisure.

Been staying at The Standard since 2008 and it's hard to beat! The rooms, the view, the vibe... it's sheer perfection made even better by the friendly staff. We love Marie P., who we first met in the grill and now works in the beer garden- she is super attentive and could not be nicer of more fun. We love Le Bain and top of the standard- nothing like having great bars on your rooftop, making the commute home easier ;) Meatpacking packed w amazing restaurants. Can't recommend enough <3

A friend and I stayed here for a quick weekend away. There were no rooms with 2 beds so we shared a bed, which is fine, but what was really strange was the glass-encased shower. This shower is in every room in the hotel. Are there that many people that prefer to shower in front of someone else? Does it make it easier to optimize the room layout? OK so besides the shower - here some basic pros and cons.Pros - Great location. Meatpacking is where it's at! And of course - sitting atop the High Line isn't too shabby.Outstanding food & bev on premesis (the bar on the terrace was WONDERFUL as was the staff - so nice!)Staff was extremely helpful and kind.Room was clean and quiet with a great view.Cons - Room was tiny, even for NYC.Elevator service was TERRIBLE. There's a certain time during the day (early evening) where hotel guests must SHARE the elevators with the hipsters trying to get up to the club. At a certain time (later in the evening), hotel staff usher the guests to a working elevator while clubgoers wait for their own, but before that it's absolutely insane.Price - this hotel is SO EXPENSIVE. I expected more. Not sure what - but more.So - though I somewhat enjoyed this alien experience, I wouldn't stay again.

You would think that spending $250/night to stay here would allow a guest the small privilege of visiting their rooftop bar by just taking a lift up from your floor...but you would be wrong! 5/5 to management for penny pinching/frustrating guests and 1/5 for guest service.

Everything about the Standard is certainly in contrast to the name of the establishment. All aspects of this hotel are anything but the standard when it comes to a typical stay in New York, or elsewhere. First off, the service provided by hotel employees is second to none. From my very first steps in the door, Diede at the front desk was incredibly kind, and helped with all kinds of random questions. After dealing with credit card issues (CC company block due to size of charge), she patiently worked with me to post the charge in smaller increments and wait while I talked with my credit card company. After that fiasco, she still took time to map out the neighborhood and recommend local attractions. After receiving that long list of local places for food and drink (thanks Diede and Kevin C at the front desk), I found it was hardly necessary to ever leave the property. Top of the Standard, Standard Biergarten, Standard Grill and Standard Plaza all provide entirely unique experiences and amazing tastes of the City. But, walking less than a block also opens up a plethora of wide-ranging options. I should mention, the Meat Packing District (and West Village in general) is certainly well-suited for a younger crowd, and may not be the ideal location for couples seeking a slower pocket of NYC. This said, the Standard goes above and beyond in ensuring a romantic and peaceful setting for those seeking out that style of vacation. In fact, despite the lively and youthful atmosphere in that area, the Standard could be a hotel better suited for couples seeking a romantic stay. I was put up in the hotel for work, and as a single young person looking to have some fun in the evenings, I also found that the hotel itself and general area provided endless opportunity. All this said, I would obviously not call this a family-friendly hotel either, but assume most folks looking to stay in the area already know this. The room itself was top-class, in my opinion. The view, the bed, shower, and bathroom in general were complete luxury. I found the only complaint that could be made is in regards to the size of the room, but I personally didn't need any excess space, and again, this is not the hotel for bringing along the kids. Additionally, housekeeping was beyond respectful of my privacy and belongings, and would actually go out of their way to ensure my room was cleaned each day even if I was not out of the room until after scheduled housekeeping hours. The view from my room certainly stands out and cannot be found at just any hotel in New York. It was actually difficult to leave the room at times because of the sweeping views of Lower Manhattan and Jersey City (I had a relatively clear view of the Statue of Liberty from my bed). Other sides of the building can offer even better views, from what I could tell. Overall, I would never leave anything but 5 stars, and will absolutely be back.

Decided to stay at this hotel instead of the usual one I stay at in anticipation of the heavy traffic near times square because of the Columbus day parade. I splurged and decided to get the Hudson suite for me and my significant other. Which came out to around $800. Upon arriving at the hotel approximately 45 minutes after check in which started at 3, we were told that the room wouldn't be ready for another hour and a half. Which put us in a predicament because we had to be at a concert in an hour and would have nowhere to get ready or drop our bags off or even rest after 4 hours of travel. Long story short we ended up getting ready in the only lobby bathroom holding up everyone who was trying to use it. Which made us feel even more embarrassed in a crowd we already didn't feel welcomed in. Our bags were left on the counter who with the very polite person who was assisting us with checking our bags. We only arrived back to the hotel around midnight. Our bags as well as food we ordered through grub hub were delivered up to us in the room which was nice! The room itself was extremely clean, the bed was comfortable, sheets spotless, and mini bar completely stocked with reasonable prices for the items. I also appreciated the open layout of the room with an all glass shower.  As nice as the room was, the views were subpar for rooms that are being advertised as one of the main selling points being the view. Maybe this was just because of the low floor, but we were treated to a view of construction workers and an up close view of the NYC sanitation building which was also covered in construction workers which were directly level with our room. Part of me wanted the room to be upgraded or moved to a higher floor because of the huge inconvenience of not having the room ready when it was expected to be but im not the type of person to complain to already frantic hotel personnel. Overall, I can say I certainly won't be back to this hotel. It just wasn't worth the price that I paid for it.

I came to the standard thinking I was going to stay in a high standard hotel. The rooms are tiny, their layout is not convenient and cozy. Housekeeping did not make our room and the service in general is really bad. Pretentious hostesses and so called cool waiters more busy wearing sunglasses inside the hotel and adjusting their hair do than really helping you. Only ray of light the food at the standard grill is very good, but again don't expect too much from the service, this is clearly not what they invested in.

My room was small but well appointed, modern, and clean. There was a double bed, a table with a bench, and a desk chair. The bathroom had a large tub as well as a shower. So, it was fine.The clientele seems remarkably uniformly hip. I didn't do a complete survey, but I'm pretty sure I was the oldest and least hip person in the hotel.It's located next to Chelsea Market and by the High Line. It's on an odd nook of a street which has the advantage of cutting down on some of the street noise. My room on the fifth floor wasn't exactly silent, but it wasn't noisy, and this is NYC so that's pretty good.Because it's in an odd nook, and because the Standard doesn't believe in signage, I wandered around longer than I should have trying to find it. Look for a door the color of Big Bird. Above it you might notice the upside-down sign.The wifi is free but at 1.5mbps is pretty minimal. You can instead opt to pay $20 (!) to get an unspecified better connection. There are adequate electric outlets in the room.If you're young and hip you well may like this hotel more than I did. And I liked it fine. I wouldn't seek it out the next time in NYC but I'd be happy to stay here again, if only to bring down the average age and to remind the clientele that they too someday will be old.

Not a bad hotel, we got a good offer on this however not sure it would be worth the regular price. The room was quite small and somewhat dated. The rooftop bar has fantastic views however it's only open in the late afternoon/evening at which point it is also open to the public.

The Standard has been so good to me that I had to come back for another review!! Aside from the great location, really modern rooms & design, and the great restaurant(s), I must say the staff is what makes this place great if you travel for business or for fun. Sam, the front desk manager, is always amazingly engaged and wanting to best serve her guests. I've also had great notable encounters with Colleen, Niko, Elijah, and Antoine. I visit monthly (and sometimes twice a month) and the staff goes the extra mile to make me feel at home. They are always extremely to friendly to everyone and pay attention to detail. Really enjoy staying here.

Very nice place to stay, no ambulance sounds, cool restaurants and bars, very nice neighborhood. Very kind staff. The room is not big, but a very modern and partial project make it really nice and with the sauce you need.
user_name:
Gustavo P
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: When a staycation revitalizes you as though you went abroad it's a feeling you have to share. The Hudson Suite re: panoramic views will blow you away and the tasty fare/healthy options available re: room service will likely make you hibernate. Great interactions with staff & customer service throughout re: porters/maintenance but, Regina thanks so much for helping me select a room that would reenergize. Also, the salt bath is a must try... otherwise great access to vibrant cultural downtown scene with the Whitney Museum being a stones throw away and Highline in eyes shot view.

Through confusion and mishap, our adult daughter, who was visiting New York for the day, lost her friends, her phone and all her possessions at the hotel bar. She wound up in the lobby, somewhat drunk, upset and totally at a loss for how to get back in touch in a strange city. Melinda at the front desk noticed her upset, asked her about the problem and proceeded to get the very competent hotel staff to resolve the problem, finding her friends and getting her belongings back. She really went to enormous lengths to make sure our daughter was safe, including contacting us to let us know about the problem and again when it was successfully resolved. Both her competence and her kindness were exceptional. With staff this good, you can bet I'll stay at this hotel the next time I'm in town. They are amazing.

A very trendy modern hotel - helpful staff - well appointed rooms although I didn't like the fact that the seperate toilet had no sink & the bathroom itself was open plan.I didn't eat in the restaurant but room service was excellent.Very handy for the Highline & Empire Diner.

We recently stayed at this hotel as a staycation being first time parents celebrating a birthday. The reservation and check in process via One:Night was so easy and accessible and when we got to the hotel check in, Regina was phenomenal. She advised us on which rooms and amenities we would love and helped us secure our preferred room last minute even on a busy Friday and Saturday! The room was wonderful, the view to die for, the staff so helpful, and the food was awesome. Thank you Regina for helping out these weary souls rejuvenate in luxury.
user_name:
luamky
New York City, New York

review_body: Just want to take a few minutes out of my day to commend one of your employees Samantha Yang. I recently just stayed at your highline property in New York City last weekend (Friday September 8 through the 10th). I planned a special getaway, Upon initially making a reservation and the other reservations line I booked a superior king room i mentioned to the reservations associate I specifically wanted a corner room and they were able to guarantee us a corner room. I even after the call and making the reservation i contacted the hotel front desk the day of arrival and they said we did indeed have a corner room. Upon arrival we checked in and once we got to our room, the room was not a corner room as we were promised. I went back down to the front desk and spoke to one of the front desk employees which he said the hotel is sold out and there is nothing he can do nothing about it in a slightly snide tone... He then later passed me onto Samantha Yang which had the pleasure of working with. She was so kind and courteous very understanding of the situation, and again very helpful and given it was New York fashion week I knew the hotel was hectic and instead of brushing us off she was extremely courteous to us and was able to reserve a corner room for us the following night. The following day she was able to move us early (11am) upon getting our new corner room which was AMAZING!!!! She even went as far as sending us a bottle of champagne apologizing for the mixup which we enjoyed drinking while eating the Sunset from our Riverview Corner room. I can't tell you how rare that is nowadays to have employee like that . As someone that travels so much all over the world and stays in countless hotels all over the place having an employee like that is priceless. Given how many hotels there are New York City she has guaranteed all of my, my family's, and companies future business will be given to this hotel. You've ensured my loyalty to your hotel every single time Im in New York simply due to her customer service and her attention to making sure that we were happy. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel, very modern, great location and definitely get a corner room the views are second to none

This hotel is so overhyped....not a good value, unless you like a small room, mediocre service and to boot, you will have a hard time having a drink on the top floor. Reservations are few, and after 9pm is for Members Only. What hotel leases out their best feature so their guests can not enjoy it! Amazing. I guess if you want to stand in line to be seen while checking in and out, you will enjoy it. Last time for us. By the way you can't access the High Line from the hotel, entrance is 2 blocks away. There are much better hotels in the area!!

In a recent trip to NYC, my friend I was SUPPOSED to stay with bailed last minute, and I was left wandering the streets of New York alone at 1am. Clearly, I was a bit distraught, but thankfully I found the standard. Front desk Dave was a complete angel and totally turned my trip around. He also recommended a place to grab a sandwich and cup of coffee in the morning and a park to go watch some dogs play and destress! Glad to see so many people appreciate front desk Dave as much as I do!

I don't live in NYC but I came here for brunch on Sunday with my girls. Best choice we made the whole dang trip, our server Jade was super cool and even gave us fashion advice about the stores in the area. The food was phenomenal, had eggs benedict and mimosas before we went shopping nearby. Highly recommend this spot! Thanks Jade!

The hotel goes above and beyond to surprise and delight their guests. Each detail brings a smile. From the imaginative photo animation in the elevators to the interesting and so cool publications in the rooms you will never be bored here. The location is top-notch, right above the High Line and steps from the Whitney. We never had a bad meal and tried room service and the cafe at street level, my most favorite lunch spot where you'd swear you were in Europe. The plaid outfits on the wait staff and adorable and menu is perfection. We had a beer in the beer garden because, well, why not? Ping pong tables are fun and the Pale Ale was tasty on a hot afternoon. It was a scene at night with a line 20 deep for beer tickets. If you can find it, take the elevator to the formal cocktail lounge and you will feel as though you walked onto a perfectly cast movie set, a spectacular interior gives way to all of Manhattan, surreal. Little touches like the note by the phone to call and make a political statement are fun and I LOVED the bookmark in "1984" urging me to steal the book (with the $10 they will put on your bill going to the NEA). Front desk staff charming and accommodating. This hotel is a treat and if you are looking for a hip, stylish hotel with a real party vibe, the Standard goes above and beyond.

The Standard goes out of its way to be ironic. The logo is upside down, and their hotel is anything but standard. The lobby looks like an upscale waiting area. It is a bit unsettling in a good way.....Are you in a library or some kind of club...even the elevators are unstandard with animation playing in each liftThe rooms remind me of a typical New York hotel, only bigger and better appointed.
