You can actually stretch out in theseLastly, The Standard is a very cool place to stay. The Beer Garden was fun and every restaurant was excellent for breakfast and dinner. All very well executedSo if you are looking for an eclectic place that knows hospitality, then The Standard should be your standard place in NYC

I moved out of NYC nearly 4 years ago, and so on my trip back I try to stay somewhere new. I think that tradition is over now that I've stayed at The Standard. With perfect views no matter where you are, the ubiquitous HighLine just below, and a number of bars and restaurants attached you could get a full NYC experience without even leaving the confines of the hotel (seriously, next time a blizzard is coming I'm checking in until its over). Also, they are pet friendly and totally treat the pets like royalty too!As for the dining and drinking options, My fave is the Biergarten and then The Patio for a nightcap. Looking to expand beyond the Wall? The Standard High Line is perfectly located within walking distance to Chelsea Market, the Meatpacking district (clubs! bars!), and not far from 14th Street. All in all, a perfect way to experience the best NYC has to offer.

The Standard High Line is probably one of the hippest spots in NYC right now. It has a lively buzzing atmosphere and a very chic clientele. The staff were for the most part friendly, accommodating, and nice to look at ;). The rooms were very small, but with the wall of windows, still offered spaciousness. Note: people below on the street and High Line can see completely through the room windows as they are not mirrored or tinted. So if you don't want to be seen, pull the shade! I would also recommend bringing your own pillows, they are SUPER soft, no support. We are at the restaurants and had excellent service every time. The food is delicious. The only turn-off I had about the hotel is that of you want to go to the rooftop or cocktail lounge you have to wait in line and even that doesn't guarantee entrance. I understand that they want to have a certain crowd up there, however hotel guests should have access. It was no problem for us to get the "approval" from the doorgirl to go up, but getting through the line on the street was such a hassle. I will say that once we got up there we had a great time. All in all, we had a great time and enjoyed our stay.

Save your money. This hotel may be the worst quality hotel in New York City. Horrible maintenance and service. I had a suite for one night and the toilet was totally clogged up, the TV didn't work and the light bulbs in several areas of the suite were burnt out. Complaints to the management got me a $97.00 reduction on a $1,200.00 bill. The drapes were so bad the the room lite up at first sign of sunrise. Terrible management and I will never ever stay in this hotel again. SUB-STANDARD.

Concierge Colleen Burst could not be more supportive, informed, and helpful. The Standard team always make my stay an excellent experience. The Standard, High Line, is a complete zen zone with all the buzz you would ever want from NYC.

Tonin was super professional and beyond helpful! From Directions to good places to eat, even muscle when I needed help getting my bags in and out the car and hotel. I definitely enjoyed fashion week at the standard hotel and grill!

This is a strange hotel, located south of 16th Street near the Hudson River. It starts when you walk through the revolving yellow door into the lobby under the hotel name, which is upside down. As you ascend in the elevator, you face a continuous-loop animated video playing on the elevator walls. It depicts, among other images, the World Trade Center Twin Towers in flames, with people leaping to their deaths, and a hooded Ku Klux Klansman! Very offensive. The small rooms have floor to ceiling windows; ask to face the river and the view of Jersey City and Hoboken! The shower had no curtain at all, so water pooled all over the bathroom floor. Why? Worse, the glass wall one one side of the shower faced the room and the window, so there was no privacy. Why? I noticed at least one creep parked on Little West 13th Street gazing up at people showering! The bed was low but comfortable. The room had a TV, a safe, wi-fi, and a mini-bar. But there was no coffee in the room, no soda machine, no water bottles, no clock.The dog park below and the bars produced both barking and drunken laughter into the night, so bring earplugs. The hotel has a silly and unenforceable rule prohibiting guests from bringing their own booze. We were quoted a wedding base rate of $294 per night; but then they charged us a base rate of $325 for the second night. And they added a $2 'Contribution'! What right do they have to force a donation to their favorite, unnamed charity?! They said they would 'look into all this' , but we've heard nothing. So watch you bill carefully.I would not pick this strange place again.

You can't beat the location of The Standard High Line. You're steps away from the stairs leading up to the High Line itself, plus Chelsea Market, the subway, and tons of great shops, bars, and restaurants. Our standard king room was small, but the design maximized the space. We requested a curtain for our shower ahead of time, and that worked out well. (Without a curtain, you'll just have a transparent glass wall separating you from the rest of the room -- and anyone else in it.) We also requested a quiet floor, and we slept very well.

My wife and I stayed at The Standard last weekend. The hotel staff managed to ruin our anniversary weekend from the moment we arrived at the hotel. Shortly after getting to our room we received a phone call from the front desk stating that our car, which we had valeted (for an additional $65/night) had received a ticket. Instead of the hotel acknowledging fault and offering to take care of the ticket management insisted that I should go to court and fight the summons. I have never experienced such terrible customer service at a "premium" hotel. Not only was I forced to pay for the summons the hotel valet accrued for my vehicle but the hotel refused to waive the valet fee on top of that. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone, avoid it at all costs!

We stayed over night at The Standard and the rooms were pretty cool. The concierge was extremely kind and helpful. The room we had was clean and had a beautiful view of the Hudson. Such a convenient location also

I stayed at the Standard for one night in July. Nizar was super nice and took care of my Valet for me. Nico was so friendly when he helped check me in and so was Samantha who recommended some cool bars to check out for the night. Mario helped bring my bags up and had me cracking up! The room had a great view in it and it was cleaner than other hotels I have stayed at in New York. The next morning Colleen checked me out and recommended a breakfast spot down the street that I loved! And when I came back for my Valet Kevin helped me call my car back and in the meanwhile we had a great conversation. All in all the staff was super friendly and accommodating! Will be back for sure!!!

Our time at the Standard was...WONDERFUL this past weekend. Such a beautiful hotel, with so much to offer. So happy we decided to book with The Standard. It definitely was the cherry on top of our stay in NYC. We called and booked through Casey at guest services. She was super helpful and friendly. We were able to get a room updated, and breakfast included in our stay... thanks again and keep on doing what you do... everything was perfect!

The hotel is amazing! it has one of the greatest rooftops with an incredible view! I highly recommend going to Le Bain (the bar at the rooftop) is really cool with many fun people and it also has a nightclub.

We met a NY resident friend at the Patio Bar at the Standard after walking the High Line and before dinner and a night at Terra Blues in the Village. The bar and garden is restful and the furniture in shades of orange. It is often hard to get into this or any of the other bars and restaurants of the hotel so booking is suggested at busy times in the evenings. The High Line passes directly over the patio outdoor Patio bar. Service was very good and the barman was able to make some lemon, lime and bitters drinks that were refreshing after a along walk. Highly recommended for a visit.

Customer service was hit and missMy teacup in my room did not get replaced each day and I had to call each dayPick a low floor if you go unless you like club music until 4am!!Food in restaurant good and waitstaff attentive but not pushy Rooms are small for a long stay - good for long weekend Right on the hi-line which is great - but I would shop around for a better hotel next time

When I stayed at the Standard Highline, Kaheen and his concierge team were amazing. The room was always clean and comfortable, food delicious and it was always so welcoming. The view of the hudson was perfect! I love this property and can't wait to come back!!!

After a huge amount of deliberation we opted for the Standard over our previous meatpacking hotel the Dream. We arrived to find a room which had a bit of a smell and were not overly impressed. A quick phone call and we were offered a room on the 17th floor underneath the bar / rooftop nightclub. Whilst a little noisy it didn't bother us and the room was close to the elevators and right next to the gym. Staff did say if this was not suitable to let them know. My girlfriend loved the fact that the Elevators are the famous ones where Jay Z and Beyonces sister had their fall out but besides this they have a weird video thing going on!!couple of elevator facts!!Staff were super friendly in the hotel and couldn't help / do enough. It is obviously one of the very happening places in the meatpacking district so we struggled to get a drink at the beer garden at the door and when we did we had to sit inside. They seemed so busy that the service was not great and was only disappointing thing in terms of this. Housekeeping were fantastic and I really wanted to leave our lady a tip. Needed to know she would get it though. Basics of the hotel. Great shower / towels / bed - very comfy / plenty of sockets / fresh towels everyday and free wi-fi was even ok. Good location close to lots of restaurants and Chelsea Market / Gansevoort Market. Would highly recommend and the final part - pay extra for a room facing the Hudson it really is worth it!I always think a hotel stands and falls if u would stay again and I would have no worry about coming back here again!

A convenient boutique hotel if visiting Chelsea or the meatpacking district. The hotel’s architecture is mid-century modern and the overall vibe at the Standard Highline is being “different.” I stayed for one night and had requested an early check-in. They accommodated my request and I was assigned (I believe an upgraded room) by noon. The room was small but looked exactly like the pictures I saw – queen bed, small bath/shower area, a tiny W.C./toilet and space for clothes. The desk and leather swivel chair were quite comfortable for working and enjoying a quick bite on the adjoining settee. The room had a floor to ceiling window with a view of the river in the distance and a parking lot / Highline below. The city view is also quite nice in the evening. The outdoor plaza at the lobby level felt hip and lively. A no frills practical modern hotel and everything worked great. The bed was very comfortable and there was barely any street noise. I’d stay again if visiting the Highline neighborhood.

We stayed here for the weekend. The location was ok. As long as you're able to walk you'll be just fine. There is a restaurant and several bars within the hotel and/or on the same block. The check-in experience was not ideal - we wanted to carry our own bags up to the room because we were in a bit of a rush for a rehearsal dinner and they insisted that someone bring them up. 30 mins later still no bags. When we phoned down to the lobby, they didn't seem to have a great handle on where exactly our items were. We waited for quite a bit. The elevator situation is horrendous. I think I spent most of my weekend waiting for an elevator. At times they have only two in operation with something like 17 floors. Ended up taking the stairs a lot. The room itself was nice - but if you're not into the modern concept - you will not like this room. There is no privacy for the shower area so if you're staying here with a friend who you don't want to shower in front of you may want to get separate rooms. In our particular room the shower pressure was awful and the water just pooled all over the floor - including in front of the sink. What a mess. We did have a really nice big bathtub and because of the open concept it offered a great view right from the tub - this was really nice. On Saturday we asked for "Privacy Please" as we had several valuable items in the room that did not fit into the safe. Upon coming back to the room later that day, the room had been cleaned. I was livid. Such a complete disregard and disrespect for our wishes. I was stunned. I did find the staff to be quite friendly but still would not stay here again.

I was blown away by my stay at The Standard, High Line. I was kindly upgraded to the corner room overlooking the city and the Hudson River. The view and experience was spectacular. The staff were friendly and efficient. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable with great bed sheets. And I loved the simple yet cool and elevated design finishes. The location is also superb - in the heart of the meatpacking district next to the High Line. I also loved the outdoor rooftop bar with incredible views, and the Boom Boom room. I couldn't recommend this hotel more!

Classic New York hotel which defines the Meat Packing District. It's fun and energetic with a buzzy metropolitan vibe. The rooms overlooking the Hudson are amazing and it's difficult not to have a good time here. Le Bain roof top is the place to be in the summer for daytime drinking and people watching ... the queue can go round the block some days! The boom boom is awesome for Saturday nights with amazing decor but the staff can be ....up themselves! Lots of choice reading food which is done to a high standard!! The location is great, this place has been a at the top of the charts in NY for a while but it's still holding its own!
user_name:
BobsieStar
New York City, New York

review_body: I recently stayed in The Standard Hotel for two weeks whilst on a course in New York City. I was made very welcome by the helpful staff who could not do enough for me, and stayed in a pleasantly appointed room (with a very comfy bed) on the 7th floor. I had several delicious meals at The Standard Grill, and enjoyed cocktails on the rooftop terrace and cocktail bar, both of which have incredible views across The Whitney Museum, The Hudson River and The High Line. Although the hotel is beginning to look a little tired, it did not detract from my stay and I would definitely visit again.

During my stay I found an open red bull in the fridge, food crusted on the edge of the living room table, holes in the duvet cover, and the shower would not drain properly, which is open to the rest of the bathroom, so I had to mop it up with towels. I informed the front desk of the red bull as soon as I noticed it. Right before checkout I saw an open seltzer water on the shelf, and upon checkout I found I had been charged for $60 of mini fridge items, which they did remove from my bill. However, the next day after I left, I got another charge for $75 of items that I did not have either. Not only is it unsanitary to leave items from previous visitors, but it seems to have caused a lot of confusion.On top of that wifi was slow, room service food was cold and soaked in grease, but at least the staff was nice.Edit:While the hotel was very helpful with the first accidental charge, they were not as kind with the second. I was charged for a $55 bottle of tequila among other items. When trying to get a refund I was redirected to a phone line that would not pick up. I was able to get slow responses through email. Through those emails, I was told that the staff confirmed the removal of the items and that the housekeeping follows up with what was taken out of the room after the stay. I understand how mini-fridge charges work, but I didn't touch those items. They were condescending and said they would do an adjustment as a one time courtesy. It is not a favor for me when you incorrectly charged me for items I did not consume and were probably not in the room in the first place. I see other reviews stating the same problems. Please fix your system.

I booked a room at the Standard High Line via Booking.com at a pretty reasonable rate as part of a surprise staycation for my Boyfriend's 30th birthday. Shortly after I made the booking, I called the Hotel's Concierge department to ask if they could help me with the surprise - Balloons, cake etc...and they were more than happy to help! The person who liaised with me - Matthew Petromilli immediately sent over options, hotel-approved vendors, price lists for various things that I might want to order, etc...On the day itself, (we checked in on a Saturday afternoon, a little later than intended), we were upgraded to a bigger room (i think it was a Junior Suite wth a view of the City, if I remember correctly) and when we entered the room, it was already decked out in all the decorations I had ordered! about 15 minutes after we settled down in our room, a hotel staff came by with a complementary bottle of Prosecco and Snacks - just coz it was my Boyfriend's birthday! They even brought the cake I ordered over at exactly the time I wanted it delivered! The service levels are off the charts! The staff are very friendly and helpful - special thanks to Matthew Petromilli an Simon (I didn't get your last name) who was at the front desk who checked us in - for your effort and help!

Hotel is quite chic in a good area. Rooms are very small as expected in NY but they are clean and tidy. Hotel does not have much facility but a good area where you can access food, galleries and night life easily. Lifts to rooms could be problematic as 2 out of 4 lifts are blocked Thursday to Saturday nights for exclusive use to bar on rooftop. Quite pricey in that location. Not recommended for family with young kids

I've visited the Standard a few times this summer. You can expect a busy bar, reasonably priced cocktails and lots of young working professionals. Great place to hang out with friends for an easy-going evening and a few drinks. It tends to be difficult to grab a seat as the bar gets crowded in the evening, but if you don't mind standing, this is a perfect spot to appreciate the sun setting over New Jersey!

The Hotel is GREAT crisp modern lines with a room service menu that was hands down the best I have had. The rooms are small but its all about the view.The elevator has the trippiest video playing we had to stay and watch it multiple times.
user_name:
Davidjohn13
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is in an awesome location on the Highline. Lots of great bars & restaurants nearby. Hotel is pretty trendy - everyone was decked out, even at 9am! We barely slept just with the hooping and hollering from the hallways all night. I'd say it's a great hotel for a younger crowd that plans to party all night. For anyone who wants a good sleep, not my favorite. The room is also a bit weird in its layout.

This is my second time staying at The Standard, High Line and every single time I leave we find excuses to make a trip back. The hotel itself is an architectural wonder and decorated impeccably. This hotel has everything young adults would likely look for when traveling to New York - and all in the same building. Between the Biergarten, The Top Of The Standard and Le Bain, you really can't go wrong when it comes to grabbing a drink at one of the most desirable bars in the Meatpacking area. The location itself cannot be beat, walk downstairs and grab the Highline, walk a few blocks to Chelsea Market for a bite, and stores, restaurants, and bars galore within immediate walking distance. Apart from the hotel's amenities and location, we found the service to also be incredible. We were helped all weekend by Colleen Burst, the sweetest concierge staff we've had the pleasure of meeting! She did an excellent job at always accommodating our last-minute requests and offered recommendations all weekend which we were never disappointed by.The room we always stay in is the Hudson Studio. It is hands-down our favorite hotel room which we have ever stayed in! Incredible panoramic views of the Hudson with the best hotel-room sunset views I've ever had the fortune of having. Make sure to plan to catch the sunset from the bathtub! The best part of this hotel is the unobstructed views you'll have from any room - both high and low floors! Regardless if you opt for city view or Hudson, the view blows any other NYC hotel room view out of the water. I look forward to making another New York trip soon and as always - will surely be returning back to The Standard!!

Great hotel- located right near the Chelsea Markets. This is the place to stay if you want plenty of options for going out, dinner, breakfast, brunch and a decent coffee. Within walking distance to a number of great eateries and a short walk from the subway and Highline. We found it about 20-25 mins to most major attractions.The hotel was well presented great views and the staff were great. Roof top bar is a must visit!

Had a most incredible stay at this lovely hotel. Room tres chic by New York standards with plenty of room for two, big comfy beds and if you get a high floor the view of the river and or the city is amazing! Lively weekend parties on the roof if you're into that stuff and food and service was overall excellent. Very close access to The New Whitney and a walk on the High Line is a MUST!

From the moment we walked in for our couples getaway we were enthralled by the style and ambience of the hotel. We loved our room and didn't want to leave. You can enjoy the bustling NYC meatpacking district right outside as well. The standard was the best choice for us looking for something unique and memorable....amazing FD staff and the smiles and attitude made an already great Hotel even better, we felt very welcome 5 stars ...

Our family of 4 had a nice four-night stay at the Standard High Line. We were informed when booking the rooms that we could not put 4 people in any of their rooms, that they had no adjoining rooms and would not give any assurances that our rooms would even be on the same floor. We wanted to go ahead and give it a try mainly because of the location, so we got two rooms. Check-in was easy - front desk people were fine. We did get two rooms right next to each other on the 11th floor. We had "city view" rooms and had a very nice view of the Empire State Building - and also a good view of the Hudson River. (There does appear to be new construction just a block or so away in the line of site of the Empire State Building - so hopefully that does not block the view in the future). We did not have any issues with noise as others have described. On various websites, it does list the Standard as having a pool - but we asked at checkin and they said "no pool for kids". This was fine as we kept quite busy otherwise. While the hotel itself is not necessarily geared to kids, we found it to be a great central location for a family trip. And there were a few other families with kids at the hotel. We walked the Highline every morning - the Highline ends right near the tour boat pier. A few block walk to the subway line. Very close the Chelsea Market. Overall, nice rooms and great central location for a family vacation headquarters. .

This hotel is another NYC disaster. Overpriced, trying to be hip, and fails at the basics of a hotel. Basics are: Decent room, comfortable bed, some food options, and reasonable amount of quiet. The only area where The Standard meets the basics is on food options.Let's start with the room. Typical small space of NYC hotels. Bathroom, some sort of bizarre combination of tub an shower where the shower essentially sprays water everywhere. All over the floor and the sink. So you end up walking in a big puddle. Items on the sink get wet. And there isn't much you can do about it. The bed? The bed is euro style meaning it's essentially a box on the floor. That's not bad, I've stayed in plenty of European hotels and love their beds. But they put some cushy mattress on the box which does not work. I woke up with a great deal of back pain as a result.Let's talk noise.... my room overlooked the Hudson and one of the highways. And apparently a garbage barge given the amount of beeping and other noise going on all night. But that was ok because the Disco was vibrating the room until at least 3am so I wasn't going to sleep anyway. When I complained, the front desk laughed and said "yeah those floors do feel the disco. Just get up and dance!". Er, sorry but I didn't pay $300+/night as an entry fee to some bad disco.What was fun was the people watching which is apparently what people do here. If that's what you are in to, I suggest you do the people watching, pay for the overpriced restaurant (but normal for NYC standards) and sleep somewhere else.

Right in the middle of the meatpacking district, The Standard is not your average hotel. Everything from the entrance to the elevators to the rooms is NOT standard. Great place to stay when you want to experience and discover New York. At the entrance to the hotel are several great places to eat and drink and the hotel itself has a great rooftop bar with stunning views of the city and the harbor. Make sure to run into Michael Alongi for arranging anything around suitcases and taxis. He'll make it happen!
user_location: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
user_name:
264heiniw
Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

review_body: Right from the minute I walked into The Standard the staff was friendly and attentive. Kevin at the front desk was a pleasure to talk to and provided me with some local restaurants and bars to check out. I was even given a complimentary upgrade. Will definitely be returning!

On a recent trip to New York with a friend, we visited The Standard on the recommendation of our respective sisters during a walk on the High Line. While we knew it would be a typical city bar, overpriced drinks and crowded, we were definitely not disappointed by the main attraction - the view from the rooftop. The bar has its own entrance (which we didn't realise, and ended up in the middle of the hotel....), and from what we saw of the hotel itself it looked gorgeous. The view is one not to be missed if you're in Chelsea/Meatpacking District, and if you really want to make the most of it make sure you're there early to get one of the elusive seats along the edge of the balcony.

Great rooms, great view. Bar is absolutely stunning, reservation is mandatory, the view is unbelievable The hotel is very centric and you can reach walking distance the Hudson and Chelsea Market.Will certainly return to the Standard as soon as I am in town. Did I mention the bar is stunning?
user_name:
JRRosario
San Pedro Garza Garcia, Mexico

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed my stay. I appreciate their "standard rate" rooms which have a check-in/out anytime policy. Very convenient for the flight times that are late at night. Rooms are nice and comfortable and there is a gym on the top floor with great views. All food and drink outlets are very popular in the city. Just be aware of the following:1) the Wifi quality is woeful... very slow. You have an option of trading up to a high speed connection but this will cost you $20... quite a shame2) The elevators are very slow. At times they limit the lifts to 2 lifts only. In addition, the staff (housekeeping, room service, ...) also use the guest lifts, and they don't always respect the line being formedMight consider coming back to stay here

Very nice Hotel with a nice view and good restaurants arround ... we loved to have the whitney Museum arround ... to have a look at high line in the morning (not to crowdy)... nice and competente reception team ... charming

One of the best stays we've ever had. The space feels luxurious from the moment you arrive and you'll be continuously entertained by its unique features, case and point the elevator animations. The staff welcomed us warmly and we felt very taken care of the entire night. We ate dinner at the hotel before leaving for a show and enjoyed panoramic views of the city around us as we dined. Our room faced northeast and early in the morning we were woken up by the most gorgeous sunrise. The room, the restaurant, the halls, the lobby, everything was clean and beautiful. Very impressed.
user_name:
mghnrystr
New York City, New York

review_body: Just had a fantastic dinner at The Standard and wanted to say how fantastic our waiter Sean was. I have never had such an incredible experience and wanted to say a massive thank you to Sean for making our evening so wonderful. Food was superb too! Cannot wait to come back. Thank you!

For a good trip to New York, I can't picture a better place to have stayed. Location, vibe and views were all on point. I love the showers the best, they are rainfall and the layout is great. Hope to come back soon!

Stayed in the Hudson Suite on the 7th floor. Asked at the desk to be put in a high floor to avoid the street noise at night. On Friday night the noise was horrendous. Not sure if it was from the Brass Monkey next door or the le Bain on the roof top. regardless, this made the night difficult. Saturday night was much better.The view of the Hudson from these suites is one of the best in NYC. Got to choose view over noise. They should be able to do something to the windows reduce the noise.

This has been the second time I've stayed at the standard and it's amazing. The rooms are wonderful, the bar upstairs and the rooftop are a great experience and the staff, in particular Kevin Chong made the time we spent as pleasant as possible.

After walking the highline we came down and stopped at the Standard. We enjoyed drinks and appetizers after an enjoyable walk. We sat outside on their beautiful patio. Great place to people watch with drinks and some light fare. If your on the Highline stop ny it is well worth it.

I ordered a cup of mint tea. I don't know the brand but it was great. The burger and fries were perfect; but the best ever was the cream filled donuts. You haven't eaten a donut until to taste this. I had to take some home.Standard is a family friendly place with great seating. A must go!
user_name:
Denise B
New York City, New York

review_body: My girlfriend and I just returned home from an amazing visit to the Standard High Line. Everything about our visit was perfect, from the hospitality, to the room service! We got upgraded to the best hotel room in NYC that I've ever stayed in. Spectacular views in every direction! The bed - unbelievable. It looked like my girlfriend was sleeping in a cloud. We can't wait for another visit, and it will probably been sooner than expected! Huge thumbs up!

The Standard on the high line is a hard show to beat. Great location in meat packers district, trendy staff and guests, wonderful rooms, amazing views. The top floor restaurant and roof deck are spectacular though the menu is rather basic and the hostesses could use some sharpening up of their lackadaisical act. The room design is extremely effective: the rooms are not large but so well laid out that they feel spacious. Tasteful mid century design works beautifully. Mirrors are strategically placed to maximize the view. No fussy electronics or light switches. Everything is straightforward and exactly what you want. Front desk check in by hipster John was competent and friendly. I'll definitely return.
user_name:
PhilipE349
Hong Kong, null, Hong Kong

review_body: We booked for 2 nights and checked out after just one. This place is out of touch with how to provide guests comfort, convenience and a restful sleep. Room was in poor shape and very badly designed. Bed sagged into the shape of a 'V' leaving me with a nasty backache. Soiled carpets, worn finishes and scratches on all the furniture did not scream "luxury" or "exclusive" to me. No place to easily plug in your phone while in bed, toiletries were unbranded and wall mounted like you might see in a gym, and the shower had miserable water pressure.Worst of all, the place is super noisy. We were up for 3 hours in the middle of the night due to a drunken party in the suite next to ours. There are too many better places to stay in NYC that are "real" hotels. Think twice before staying here. It may be cool but is not practical or comfortable and 100% not worth the money.I'll bump it up to two stars because the staff took care of us but our experience was simply pathetic overall.

They were all nice and Micheal was very helpful and kind!have a great view, i would recommend river view! roof top bar have amazing view, should def check it out.I would def go back again for next NY trip! :)

I recently visited the Standard and stayed there to visit the Whitney Biannual and was there for Easter. I was upgraded by Kevin at the front desk to one of the River Suites.Awesome room, giant tub, very decadent. The stay was great and the staff are always there to help.
user_name:
Joseph U
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed overnight at the Standard Highline. We found the service by everyone who works at the hotel to be quite exceptional. Our corner room on the 13th floor had an amazing view facing south toward Lower Manhattan and the Hudson River and Jersey City/Hoboken. The shower is slightly exhibitionist-style with its floor to ceiling window and just a scrim curtain. The room was beautiful and well-appointed.We also enough drinks at Le Bain/Top of the Standard and brunch at The Standard Grill.

The great experience of this funky-chic retro-styled hotel begins with the lobby and check-in experience. The front desk staff is professional yet friendly and low-key. Emma Knobel, took care of us, and every aspect of our check-in, covering all the hotel's amenities and must-see spots in the area, from dining to shopping to entertainment.The rooms, while funky, and retro-cool and spare, are comfortable.

I loved the hotel, the location and ambiance, BUT..... beware of a lack of transparency in the booking process. I booked through the hotel website and maybe that was mistake #1. As a patron of the hotel it is up to you to double check everything. You will not be alerted on differences in room rates for your stay. I never received a confirmation of my booking and when I called (mistake #2, I should have emailed so I had a communication trail) to ask for one I was told that yes that had my booking and that they would email me a confirmation. The confirmation was never mailed. The huge difference in the room rates was on the sheet I signed upon checking in and I should have noticed it. However, like most travelers, I was tired and anxious to get to my room; so I wasn't as observant as I should have been. But I can't help but think that it shouldn't be up to me to have to be extra-vigilant about this. Good customer service would make that unnecessary as I would have been alerted about that at the beginning, during the booking process - and then reminded again with the confirmation that I never got. There is a lot of competition in the hospitality industry and misleading practices and processes such as this should not go unremarked.

I have had another wonderful stay at the High Line and it's a big thanks to Chris and Kevin at the front desk! They always make sure our stay is perfect and exceed our expectations in service. Hope to see them again soon!

This hotel was spot on, cannot ask for a better alternative. Walking distance to tonnes of boutiques, restaurants and jazz clubs. Comfortable, clean, cleverly decorated, vintage feel rooms. Wonderful rooftop and lively beer garden. Highly recommended for a couples break.

I booked a room for my birthday and had the BEST time. When I arrived to check in, they told me I was being upgraded to a suite. The room was unreal and the view was insane. They even sent me a bottle of Rosé to say happy birthday! Colleen and Regina were especially lovely! Would absolutely recommend.

I attended a conference there and can't wait to actually stay there. The hotel is beautiful, the views are incredible, and the service was top notch. I'd like to single out the front desk staff and also Michael Alongi, who took care of my ridiculous amount of bags that I checked in - far too many for someone who wasn't actually staying at the hotel. Michael gave me friendly service and made me feel like a first-class guest.
user_name:
Matt S
New York City, New York

review_body: Were there for two nights as basically we wanted to do downtown predominantly and having walked the High Line previously, we thought the hotel was reasonably placed in what is becoming a fashionable part of the city.So, the good bits. It is situated in a lively area and is great for people watching when sitting at one of the restaurants of which there are 3. We actually did enjoy a meal at The Grill. The staff were also courteous and helpful.The big negative was the room! There was no door on the shower ( it was not missing there just was not one), the shower head was fixed with no room for movement at all, the toilet paper must have been the cheapest they could find and there was no way to plug the sink to make shaving comfortable. On top, given the high price paid, there was not even any complimentary water!In addition, on entering the lifts you have to insert you key to activate it and then select your floor. Theoretically I have no problem with this but given it is almost pitch black once the doors close, finding your floor button is difficult.Would we go again? No.

Having been to The Standard before only for drinks a few years back both my wife and I decided to stay here this time round.On arrival on a dull wet New York afternoon we were met with happy faces at check in. We were promptly shown to our room which was a superior room (i think) which ticked all the boxes. Great size (for NYC) floor to ceiling windows with a city and highline view. The bed was great, very comfortable.Unfortunately at this point i realized i had dropped my phone in the taxi from the airport to the hotel........ The guys at the desk done everything they could to retrieve this but being a yellow cab with no receipt we had little joy.We eat in the restaurant on our first night as we were extremely tired after a full day travelling and could not be bothered straying very far from the hotel. Both food and service were more than acceptable.Probably the stand out of the hotel is the top floor bar (top of the standard) there will be reviews better than mine that will explain how stunning the place is. Just make sure no matter what you do you book a seat by the window as the sun is setting. Unbelievable!! And remember your wallet........Overall i would not hesitate to stay at The Standard again. Great staff, great location, great atmosphere. Perfect!!

This area is becoming a tourist trap, the hotel feels overcrowded with tourists and the service is really bad.This said the view from the rooms is still stunning.It is quite annying when they close up all teh access to the elevators except one to accomodate the people going to the club on the top floor..

I literally have nothing bad to say about the hotel. At all. The views of the hotel are breathtaking, the decoration is beautiful and practical, the big bathtub and the shower are just perfect, and the amenities are super nice. The bar at the top of the hotel is one of the most beautiful ones I have ever seen, with a very nice and new york-type of vibe. The staff was super attentive and caring also. Also I found it was super nicely priced for what you get. I've stayed in Manhattan in other hotels and the quality/price ratio in this one is unbeatable. And it's also wonderfully located - meatpacking district. You cannot ask for anything more. 100% recommended!

Stayed in you hotel yesterday june 19 2017 and was scheduled for a week but i booked out today for safety reasons, There are no side tables to the bed, no lite switch next to the bed to turn the lights off or on when in bed, to turn the lites off you are in the dark to go to bed and can easily trip over the ledge that surrounds the bed,the same to go to the bathroom at night you have to feel your way and I stumbled on the same bed ledge and could of easily had a serious injury .I would highly recommend you add lite switches to the side of the bed and remove these gangrenous legged that serve no purpose but can be easily be tripped over.RegardsRobert Littlerlittle@regency-fire.com

I traveled with my husband and child. We loved our view so much that we had to upgrade to a corner room. The views!! We got water and city views. The first night, we had to sleep with the curtains open to take it all in. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the staff was on top of things. My nightstand had a copy of the 1984 book! The restaurant food at the garden and at the grill was excellent. I wish I had known about their awesome cake ahead of time it was my husband's birthday. The bed was perfect comfortable and clean. I slept well. I could hear some partying going on and enjoyed all the energy those people without a young child in tow had. I was so tired after my full days that all I could do at the end of the day was be happy for them and sleep! The high line location is great. We walked it a lot. Chelsea Market is so close and it is a fun walk there. Shopping opportunities are all around. We are not hip and trendy, but the hotel and most people staying there were. By association, I am super hip now. Seriously, I was very comfortable at all times and the staff added to the already great location and vibe.

I absolutely love the Standard Hotel and their commitment to service. Colleen was fantastic! She really came through with her restaurant suggestions and we had a great time! I really appreciate her commitment to service !!

Good hotel in a great area of Manhattan, minutes walk to the high line. I have stayed in a few standard hotels now and find staff friendly and helpful, this standard does have the smallest rooms of any of the others I have stayed at but I guess in manhattan most rooms are compact and at a premium. The hotel can get very busy especially in the evening

When I had an issue (which was in no way the hotel's fault), the manager, Danny, worked diligently to try to resolve it. And he, Niko and Mario were just so friendly at a time when I, quite frankly, had quite an attitude. So I thanked them for retaining their cool and upbeat ways. They made me feel so much better about the whole situation.

This is my second time in the standard hotel group, this property is good location, room was ok a bit rundown, had breakfast at the standard grill also was ok nothing wrong or surprised, but really like the top bar, very good view and service from bartender

We were upgraded by the manager since it was a birthday surprise and my girlfriend had balloons and champagne all ready! Standard's manager Regina made sure or stay was special. Will definitely stay again for a romantic stay cation in the city!
user_name:
vladimirk480
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed in the Standard last month and had a wonderful experience! The overall look and feel of the hotel is very stylish and the rooms are beautiful. The staff were very kind and helpful, in particular Regina who I would like to thank for her great hospitality. She was extremely welcoming and went out of her way to make my experience at The Standard a memorable one! I would absolutely recommend staying here and look forward to my next stay in The Standard.

This hotel is located in the very popular Meat Packing District where large meat processing plants have been replaced by Stella McCartney and Lulu Lemon. Tons of tourist walk the Highline promenade, and the beautiful new Whitney Museum is just steps away. Now, the hotel itself... über hip. I felt I should grow an insta-beard just to walk through the lobby. The check-in people were extremely friendly and welcoming. My room was very white and design-y with a fantastic view of the river. I felt comfortable and at home. They'd left some water and snacks, too. A couple of things about the room. There was no dresser or drawers of any kind, not even a shelf, nowhere to unpack, so I worked out of my suitcase for the whole stay. Also of note was the tiny toilet stall, about 4x3. Being 6'5"... well... you can imagine. All that said, the room was super quiet and the bed was extremely comfortable. Great towels, too.The elevators have cool video art, but during my rides, they malfunctioned several times. One last thing, the lobby and public areas are extremely busy, especially at night as there is a club on the top floor of the hotel. So there you have it. Not my favorite, but I WOULD stay there again. Not a calm place to be, but exciting and a lot of fun.

The Standard is a gorgeous hotel, the views second to none. But what keeps us coming back is the customer service--particularly that of Samantha Yang. She goes above and beyond and makes us feel like family.

Stayed for a few nights at The Standard with my friend and had one of the best hotel experiences of my life, mainly thanks to the manager Regina and her staff's attention. Attentive to our every request and enquiry, helping us with bar & restaurant recommendations, guest list to private events, she personally made sure that we would remember this stay as something truly special. We need more people like this at hotels!
user_name:
Daniel L
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: Had a great experience at the Standard High Line! The front desk staff were very friendly, particularly Monique and Kevin Simon. We stayed on the 16th floor with a river view. Spectacular view love the wall to ceiling windows.. The room was a little small but that was not an issue. Other reviews I read said that the noise from the club on 18 bothered them but it was not an issue. The noise was minimum. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was because of the price but regardless of that, I will be back

Yes, this is a beautiful, stylish, cool hotel with spectacular views all around. But hip hotels are all over Manhattan. What makes the Standard High Line truly exceptional is the staff. These people are simply awesome. We love them. They're kind, smart, relentlessly helpful, and incredibly hardworking. They treat you like family, not just a customer or guest. They welcome you with open arms and infectious smiles. You won't find "attitude" except the best kind. If there's ever a problem, they'll solve it as quickly as possible; and if things are perfect, well, they'll try to make them even better. I have stayed at this hotel dozens of times, and without fail, Samantha goes above and beyond to make sure everything is great--right up until we walk out the door. She is brimming with positive energy. Monique is always amazing, and one of the coolest, nicest people around. Nina is a superhero at addressing any concerns or questions that might come up. And many other staffers whose names (sorry!) I can't remember at the moment--but truly, everyone you'll encounter, from the guys at the door, to the front desk, to the staff at the gift shop is just wonderful. And, contrary to what you might assume, they love kids! And dogs. So it's the people who keep us coming back, time and again--and of course we love everything else about the Standard, from its stunning design to the superb location: a quick walk to the Whitney Museum, great restaurants and shops, the High Line, Chelsea Market, etc. And it's always lovely to stroll around the West Village, especially in the early morning, or to walk along the Hudson River. I hope to return to the Standard soon! I always leave feeling relaxed, happy, and above all, grateful.

We were in town to see Hamilton and decided to return to The Standard Highline because its location was so much fun the last time we were there. We had a slight issue upon check in - I accidentally booked the wrong room. I called to the front desk and spoke with Sam who instantly began trying to get us into the room I described. After a brief wait, Sam came to personally take us to our room. She was amazing, quick and efficient. On the train on the way back I got an alert from my credit card and noticed a wet bar charge that wasn't ours. I immediately called and was told I needed to call back between certain hours to 'speak with the person who needed to investigate the charge'. I called the next day and was told again to call back at a specific time. I explained that I wanted the hotel to fix my problem and then call me back; that I didn't appreciate having to do all the work to fix their mistake and was still told to call back!Then I remembered I had an email from my shero, Sam. I emailed her and of course the issue was instantly taken care of and my bill credited. I don't know when I'll be back in New York but I'm never booking at The Standard if Sam isn't around.Other hotel notes: We loved our meal at the restaurant; the food and service were amazing. The hotel is in a great location near the very cool highline, the amazing Chelsea Market (where you can get amazing food) and my favorite brunch spot, Cafe Cluney. Also everyone who works at this hotel is really good looking so pack your self confidence!It's a trendy, hip, millennial filled, stereotypical hip NY hotel and it's not for everyone. The elevator was a source of contention as it was locked off to guests during events causing big bottlenecks. Also if you plan to party on the roof make sure it's not closed for an event before booking. We saw some very irate guests over this.
user_name:
AlwaysOnNineOne
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Love the brand generally including the East Village and LA hotels, love the attached bars and clubs, but this hotel is mediocre. Begins with check-in and the attendant hustling you to upgrade with a clearly canned act: "hmm, let me just check on something, ... Oh it looks like the only room we have available [trails off] Wait, were you looking to upgrade?" "No? Oh, just a quiet night huh. okay..."Nothing like insinuating you're getting a terrible room and insulting you if you choose not to upgrade to start your stay off on a very low note. I've never seen anything like this at dozens of other NYC hotels, and probably never will (since I won't be staying here again). Having to deal with a shady character trying to scam you for a few extra commission dollars ruins the experience and removes this far from the realm of "luxury" hotels. This is a has-been hotel just trying to borrow from the reputation of its associated nightlife. The room furnishing here feels more dated and cheap than nice. Spotty tile floors, poor quality mattress, curtains that let in lots of light instead of blackout sufficient for good sleep, overall it feels more like a bad chain than high-end hotel. Would not stay again.

I have visited the STANDARD many many times. It never disappoints. The food is never the best nor one my favorite but the location, outside sitting, people watching, energy and service always make me very happy.I will visit it many times more and I recommend it to anyone for any hour of the day for any purpose.

We always visit New York for an annual convention in the spring each year. From year to year we have stayed in different properties. But over the last several years we have always stayed at The Standard High Line.This year's visit was made especially memorable by the great reception provided to us by Samantha Yang. She went out of her way to make our stay very special.Our maid (sorry, we didn't get her name) did a great job in keeping our room tidy and making sure that we had plenty of towels and amenities.The concierge was also very helpful. Since we were staying over on April 1, Samantha and the concierge agreed to help me play an April Fool's prank on my husband.All in all, great location, great staff and a great hotel.Thanks again.

At first, I was annoyed by the style of the hotel. Too "industrial", so to say. But the hotel was clean, functional, and the gym has awesome views, so in the end I enjoyed my very brief stay (1 night only).The way the shower is integrated into the room was interesting; again, functional, but also quite practical in the relatively small room size. Good job on the architect's side.The only fault to the room was that the bathroom sink is very shallow, which makes it hard to wash one's hands comfortably. But hey, first world problems. In the end, I'd stay here again if travelling alone, but not with family.

This hotel was mainly chosen because of it's location on the High Line in the Meatpacking District and it didn't disappoint. The location is fantastic! Walking distance to numerous great restaurants in a vibrant and authentic feeling neighborhood free of tourist traps.The room was very nice; immaculately clean (and housekeeping did an excellent job every day), comfortable bed and stunning view including the Empire State Building from the floor-to-ceiling-wall-to-wall windows that made up one wall. The bed was very comfortable, the mattress was the perfect mix between firm and soft, the pillows were soft down and the sheets were high quality. Unfortunately I didn't realize I could've bought both a sheet set and their signature comforter until I returned home - to make up my own bed The Standard High Line style.The one negative about the room for me was the lack of wardrobe/storage space. I stayed for five nights and when I'm away for that long I prefer to unpack and not live out of my suitcase. There was a small wardrobe with a shelf and a bar with a few hangers right inside the door and that was it. The only good spot for my suitcase was standing upright in the wardrobe, unless I wanted to put it somewhere in the middle of the floor where I'd risk tripping over it.I traveled with a family group and we had a dinner and several breakfasts at The Standard Grill. The food was excellent, and reasonably priced considering the quality, and the service was great. I will definitely choose this hotel again the next time I visit New York City!

Standard Hotel is always a good place to people watch. We've stayed at the hotel several times and always a fun time. Top of the Standard is a great bar, and connected to the high line now, so it's a good jumping off point.

I'll admit I have a habit of coming fairly often, but on a most recent visit for my graduation Regina at the front desk really took our stay to the next level and upgraded us to a truly incredible suite! We did have to wait a few hours to check in due to the fact that the guests before us trashed the room, but it was SO worth it! The staff, especially those at the front desk, are always so accommodating--from upgrading our room to even WATCHING MY DOG while we waited for the room (Mo, you're seriously a gem!). To people questioning why we like the place: I come here for the views, sure, but I come here for the incredible staff that ALWAYS make sure I have a great time. (And if you're not happy, pick up the phone and call down, and they'll do their best to resolve it or make up for it!)Shoutout to Sam at the front desk for sticking her neck out and helping us get to our friends' reserved table at Le Bain on a packed day...you're a hero. (The venue has its own entry policies and management, so being a hotel guest does not guarantee access.)
user_name:
elleciel
New York City, New York

review_body: The only good things I have to say about The Standard Highline is the location and the view from the rooms on the higher floors on the side with a view of the river. The service was adequate, at best, and the elevator situation and complete lack of access to the roof top bar due to private events all 3 nights we were there was ridiculous. Here are the details of my experience:I booked a corner view room at $735/night - I had stayed in 1411, a corner room on a prior stay, fantastic views from the higher rooms on that side of the hotel - For this stay, I was assigned room 510, yes, it was a corner room, but it was on a lower floor on the city side, so the floor to ceiling windows were useless with "views" of buildings and ventilation equipment on the top of nearby buildings - no views at all - and the rate was the same as my last stay - $735/night - and 510 was much smaller as well. I called the front desk explaining the difference in what I expected for $735 and what I got - they moved me to 1411, the same room I had the prior stay, but there was a 5-10 min delay for the elevator because they had 2 elevators exclusively for the private party at the roof top bar and only 2 elevators for all the hotel guests - ALL the service personnel/service carts/room service carts were also sharing the limited elevator capacity with the hotel guests, and given the size of the service carts, few guests fit in the elevator after the service equipment is loaded. I didn't realize that first night that the grossly inadequate elevator situation would be a huge inconvenience all 3 nights due to the private parties at the roof top bar, which also set up a situation where we were not able to go up to the roof top bar our entire stay - there were lines in the elevator area every night to get back up to the room, and there were also guests of the private parties trying to get on the hotel elevators thinking they could get up to the 18th floor private party without waiting in the long line for that which was outside - I mentioned my dissatisfaction with nonhotel guests making the already long elevator lines even longer, and I asked why the heck don't they put a security person to screen to make sure only hotel guests can get on the 2 remaining hotel elevators - no one seemed to care - at all...except the other hotel guests who were complaining. In addition, one of the two hotel guest elevators only allowed 3 floor buttons to be pushed at one time, so any time there were guests staying on more than 3 different floors, all the buttons reset and had to be pushed again, but only 3 at a time, so when someone got off on a lower floor, the next person up could then push their floor number. The gym is adequate, but there is no water available, other than a drinking fountain out the door - I find that most often, at a hotel where I'm paying $735/night for a room, there are water bottles in the gym and often fruit as well - minor for the hotel to provide, but so many other hotels provide that service - and that is because guests using the gym appreciate a bottle of water to use on the cardio equipment so they don't have to get off, and walk out the door to get a sip of water - or at a minimum they have chilled water available, in the gym, for guests to refill personal bottles.I was not alone in grumbling about the elevator lines, lack of access to the roof top bar and the resetting elevator buttons, all of which took away from the experience. The manager did credit 50% of one of my nights stays, a nice gesture, so my stay was $1850 rather than $2200 - but I'd rather have spent that $1850 on a 3 night hotel stay at one of the other fabulous NYC hotels - this stay was a real disappointment.

The Standard Highline Hotel is our favorite stay in Manhattan after visiting here multiple times a year for the last 10 years. Fantastic in-room hot tubs overlooking the Hudson River and located next to a beautiful walk on The Highline. In addition, it is next to the new not-to-miss Whitney Museum! Throw in their restaurant which attracts appreciative eaters not staying there. It's pricey, but worth treating yourself.

Hard to call this an "average" place because it is so unique, but the rooms are designed by someone who doesn't spend a lot of time staying in hotels. Even a standard king room was very small - an exceptionally small closet and a toilet room barely big enough for a 6 foot tall person to turn around. Very few electrical outlets (and those not conveniently mounted.) On the positive side, the staff was very helpful and it is in an uber-chic area (High Line and Meatpacking) with lots of new shops popping up. Also, amazing views from higher-up floors.

I don't get it. The rooms make me feel like I was in a bad 70s movie. The views are great but that's about it. There is nothing special about this hotel to warrant the price. I would much rather stay in a nicer hotel that is better located. Also, despite staying at this hotel, you can't access the top of the hotel except by private invitation, after a certain hour. Which pretty much eliminates any reason one would want to stay here.I would love to know why people think this place is so good.

Just like all New York hotels, the rooms are small; but the location and amenities here offset that fact. Walking distance to Highline park, Chelsea Piers, Cielo, and Whitney Museum to name a few.Additionally the beer garden on-site is now open! Prost!

Came here on a Sunday afternoon..has a beer bar and a spirits bar. They also do German bar snacks (sausages and the like) as well as giant pretzel. I had a zundenkuss which was gin, strawberry, asperol, lemon and seltzer. Very good. Friendly bar staff. They have two ping pong tables in the middle of the space which adds some variety to the place though does attract more kids than adults. They stamp your arm on entry to identify those over the age of 21. Very buzzy place!

This is the second time I've been here and the first time was extraordinary! Our group of 4 ordered a lamb burger, the salmon entree, the eggplant entree, French fries, cheese appetizer with honey, wine and chocolate mousse. Everything was beautifully presented and our waiter was top-notch, apologies for not remembering his name. He was very attentive to a nut allergy in our group and knew his menu!Each dish was very tasty and fresh with innovative seasonings. The chocolate mousse could easily serve 5 people with leftovers. Looking forward to the next visit!

As you'd expect in Manhattan, rooms at the Standard, the rooms are tiny. Just like many Manhattan rooms, there are some spectacular views. At the Standard, these come as (pardon the pun)...Standard; with no immediate high rise neighbours and floor-to-ceiling panoramic windows, you'll get an outstanding view from every room, and not be overlooked.I visited for a few nights last summer for a business trip; I LOVED the High Line location - it's a brilliant running route and being in the heart of the West Village there are many fantastic restaurants and bars nearby. The trade off for trend and being a place to be seen is of course noise - expect a jumping bar scene and some noise disturbance at the weekends. In the week, it got quieter.Great location & service, poky room but with views that more than made up for it - next time it suits me to stay in this part of the city, I'd gladly return.

NYC has a great selection of hotels. Why choose this subpar place? We did out of necessity and made an expensive mistake. A friend was staying at a hotel a few blocks away and we needed to stay late so we booked a hotel nearby to coordinate faster and better. The Standard High Line had a room. For the price of about $600 a night, we expected a decent place. Nothing fancy. Just decent. At least with good relaxed comfortable atmosphere , not pretentious, bland, devoid of authenticity and with nothing to show for. Which is pretty much what The Standard High Line is all about. Room was too small even for NYC. The corner seating is nice if there was space. But I'd prefer to have a bigger bed than something that is more like a full bed than a queen-sized bed. And please, what happened to the side tables? Where can I charge? The room only had 1 free socket to use which is at the opposite side of the foot of the bed. The music thumping from the night club reaches all the way to the lower floors. No complimentary water, snacks or even coffee served in the rooms. We have to go fetch our own coffee in the lobby????Limited personal care items. Room is devoid of character. It felt like a sterile hospital room with a view. The only reason it gets 2 stars is that the front desk personnel was thoughtful in placing us on the lower floor for any higher would have been a disaster. So we actually got a good long rest. If it weren't for the staff, I'd have 1 star. Never ever booking The Standard High Line again.

My stay at the standard hotel highline was amazing. I enjoyed myself every moment. They have the best views, tub and the best club right on their rooftop. One of the best best team members that we meet at the hotel was Tom Keller, he helped me enjoy my birthday by surprising me with a complementary bottle of wine. I will defiantly be staying here again

I went to NYC with a group of friends and this hotel is hands down the best choice we could have made. The location is fantastic, close to some great shops and restaurants, all within walking distance. If you need them cabs are always available right outside, and the views are awesome!The rooms are great, some are a little small but this is NY so to be expected, but they all have a seating area. In 3 out of our 4 rooms there was only glass between the bathroom (which has no door, only the toilet is closed off) and bedroom so if you are sharing with a friend bear this in mind. One of the rooms did have a blind to block off the 'view' so that is a possibility. The mini bar is the best I have ever seen in a hotel, stocked full of lots of goodies and naughties! Now here is my small but.....there are no tea and coffee making facilities. Now each to their own but I like to have a cup of coffee in the morning without having to get dressed and go downstairs. One morning I was too hungover to move and just wanted coffee and OJ, so I had to call room service, as you can imagine, not the cheapest! What would be perfect is a coffee machine, they can charge for the pods, I'd have no problem with that, I just don't want to get dressed for coffee!We only had breakfast at the restaurant which was good but I have heard from friends in New York that dinner is great there too.All in all a great stay, would I stay again, yes without hesitation but I would be bringing my own kettle and cafetière!

While searching for availability and pricing for NYC hotels for our honeymoon night , my wife's dream was to have a room at The Standard Highline with the amenity of a stand alone tub that faces the Hudson River or Empire State Building . So I decided to call and I spoke to Kevin C who gave us guidance and expert care top service and was patient with me while I was explaining that it was our honeymoon and we wanted something special . Kevin C went above and beyond and assured us that we where going to get an amazing room with all the details . What happened upon check in was we where double upgraded to the Empire Suite , at this point my wife and I where shocked and absolutely floored with this booking . The suite was more than We could have dreamed of , it was spectacular. We basically had our jaws dropped the whole time there from the elevator ride to entering the room . There was the huge bed , the tub facing the Empire State Building and then another room with all floor to ceiling windows with views of the river and Manhattan . We where also surprised with a personal note from Kevin wishing us a great evening and wonderful marriage with a bottle of prosecco and some snacks . This man , Kevin made our honeymoon so special and we will never forget the care and service he provided for us . Because of Kevin we will definitely revisit The Standard Highline .Fabian & Ann

After a late flight and my travel agency not confirming all the details for my booking, Niko was a Welsh knight coming my rescue. Answering all my questions, he was assertive and focused only on finding solutions. More than just friendly face at front desk, Niko is super authentic and thoughtful. He was determined to getting everything sorted out so I could check-in and relax for the busy work week ahead. Thank you Niko and to your whole family at The Standard High Line front desk! Claudia

Excellent service throughout this hotel. The hotel definitely targets the younger hipster crowd that frequents the Meatpacking District with lots of loud partying from the top floor club that spills over into the public areas at weekends. If you fit this demographic you will love it. If not, you will need to hide out in your room on one of the lower floors. Some quirky features like pitch black elevators, a window from the bedroom area into the bathroom and mattresses that are a few inches from the floor. Bed was far too soft for me, but I realize this is a personal preference. Good restaurant but wine servings by the glass were the smallest I have seen and when I ordered a second glass the waiter just topped up my partially empty glass to its former level rather than giving me a full second glass. A picky point, but it shouldn't happen.

This hotel is just amazing. The food, the people, service is great, is just ending the High line wich is a great plan to do if you have the evening off, the bars, the restaurant, all i can say is this is the complete package to visit an amazing hotel in Manhattan

I always stay at The Standard, High Line. It's the best location, great restaurant and everyone is helpful and friendly. Despite all the activity that is fun and always going on, the rooms are quiet and comfy, with the best views! Thanks to David Burgos for taking care of me on this trip!

Many thanks to Dave at the front desk for the complimentary upgrade and the glass of prosecco to the room after hearing about the dreadful situation in my apartment forcing me to a hotel in my hometown! The view from the window of our room was breathtaking - everything about the experience was relaxing and stress relieving - exactly what I needed. Stay at the standard and you will without a doubt have an exceptional, personalized experience.

We stay at the Standard Hotel on the Highline every time we're in the city - it's hands down the best hotel experience. Gwendolyn at the front desk is amazing & you just can't beat the sweeping views of the city! Perfection!!!!

The room had the most amazing views of the Hudson River and the New Jersey skyline from the floor to ceiling windows. Bed was super comfy. Shower and bath were huge. Wireless Bluetooth speaker in the room was appreciated when we wanted to listen to something something while we got ready to go out. The Top of the Standard bar on 18th floor was an experience (but expensive so be prepared!), and the hotel's restaurant The Standard Grill was amazing... We had the best burger and Lobster roll in NYC. Not to mention the fries which were to die for!Room was a little small, as to be expected in NYC. There wasn't really anywhere to put your suitcase or store clothes if you wanted to unpack... Just a small hanging space for maybe 4 items. Why 4 stars... Well, one evening, the Barman near the reception area made me sign for drinks and give my room number even though I paid in cash... I made sure I wasn't charged again upon checkout but noticed he sneakily charged 20% of the bill total to my room as a tip for himself... Even though I tipped 25% in cash at the time. Don't like underhanded tactics like that, and I let them know as much too. Attitude of the receptionist was just "well, it's only $5". Made my blood boil! My credit card was refunded a few days later.

Our room had an amazing view and such a beautiful bathrooms.The service is good and everyone is friendly. The restaurant of this place serves good food.The location of this hotel is amazing - I'm looking forward to stay there again.

We (gay couple) had a wonderful stay @ The Standard High Line! Very well located, relaxed atmosphere, room not too big but with a super bed, nice shower and a fantastic view of the Hudson River, great staff, especially we'd like to mention Eric Bell who's been very helpful with lots of tips!We'll definetly come back :-)Leo & Pierre

My husband and I stayed here for our one year anniversary this weekend. Even though we live in NYC, we liked the idea of this hotel and wanted to spend the weekend in a different neighborhood from where we live. We stayed in a deluxe queen and it was beautiful - super relaxing tub and great views of both the Hudson and lower Manhattan. We also loved looking out on the Whitney - you can even see parts of their outdoor installations from the room. The service we received was above and beyond. I mentioned that I was sensitive to noise and they went out of their way to move us to a slightly lower floor that would be quieter. I also had a cake delivered to surprise my husband, and they were great about communication and even brought it up to the room with plates, forks, etc. They also sent up a bottle of Prosecco because it was our anniversary - super nice! The only thing I would advise is that the walls are pretty thin in terms of music or bass - there was a pretty young group next to us that was playing loud music until about 1AM, but it wasn't too late and we still slept fine. Thank you to everyone at The Standard! We hope to be back soon.

My partner and I visited the Standard to have cocktails in the bar on the top floor. We didn't reserve a table and were very lucky to get a seat by the bar as we went on a particularly stunning evening. The cocktails were really delicious (fairly expensive, but that's to be expected in such unique surroundings!) the girl serving us however could barely crack a smile and looked miserable!! The views are really amazing! You can just about see the Statue of Liberty and the incredible NY skyline. Unique place and would recommend. Just hope you get a more friendly barman / bar woman next time!!

On the 03/11/2017 I was out for the weekend in New York city looking for a good hotel to spend the weekend. I thought of checking out The Standard, High Line. But on that night a few things were not working for me. I arrived late for checking and Luckily I met Simon who was at the front desk. He helped me do a quick booking online through the app. I ran through some few problems because the app only accepts credit. I had the money but in cash, so I had to locate a bank to deposit the money into my debit card because my credit card had issues. Time was moving fast and I was frustrated because I had an important meeting and photo shoot to catch up to. Like an angel...Simon advised me where to go make the deposit and also arranged for me to have a stay @ the kings suite which turned out to be the best idea and weekend ever. Just what I needed for that night. Simon made my day.Without Simon this could not have been possible. From that night and experience The standard, High line is my favorite hotel. And People like Simon make things happen instinctively. Great and professional customer service plus intelligence you cannot find this at many places.Thank you Simon.
user_name:
knightstan
New York City, New York

review_body: I had a really enjoyable stay here recently. Super nice staff and rooms. When we arrived, Niko helped us feel like we were extra special. I would highly recommend this to others and will be back!Love the views and the large windows, the shower / bathtub situation is also superb.

Wonderful view and awesome atmosphere. A design standard masterpiece. On the top of that, a very good service. We have been in contact with two employees who solveed our little issue straightaway. In particular, let we thank :Terrel Caruth and the stilish black lady with the grasshoppers tattoo. Very kind personnel and wonderful place. You need to see it once at least!

I've been meaning to write this review for a while but I really think the experience I had warrants it. I was visiting New York with my boyfriend for Valentines Day weekend and we decided to stay at the Standard because of it's central location to all of the great shopping and restaurants. The Hotel was wonderful but what really made the stay special was the friendly staff. There was a front desk lady who's name I believe was Monique - she was absolutely lovely to us. Monique gave us some great recommendations (one music venue in specific she suggested in the area was beyond amazing). Monique even remembered how much my boyfriend and I loved chocolates and had some Valentines-themed sweets sent to our room. It was the small gestures and attention to details which she showcased that really made our stay truly enjoyable. I will definitely be coming back as long as the staff remains friendly and genuine. GREAT TIME!

My wife and I stayed here for a weekend trip to NYC. We booked the Superior King room with the city view because we wanted one of the higher floors. We ended up on the 16th floor which was great! The view of the city was awesome, especially at night. Some people have said that the higher rooms are not as quiet as the lower floors because of the club on the roof. I'd have to say that we didn't notice any more noise than usual for a hotel and that was even with a well attended, private party going on up there. The minibar was well stocked and not really outrageously priced on most things. The room was clean and well kept. If you are traveling with family or friends and are on the shy side though, this room place may not be for you. The shower was all glass on two sides and no door. We loved it but things could get kind of awkward if you and your buds are there for a night LOL. In all reality, this place is for couples and partying and it hits it out of the park in those two categories. Front desk staff and the valet attendants were friendly and helpful. If you stay here, definitely pay the $65 for valet parking as the hotel sits on a side street and parking is almost non-existent. Trust me, it's well worth it. All in all, it's a great hotel. We will definitely be staying here again

I stay at the Standard every 5-6 weeks for work and it's my home away from home. I love the hotel for it's great location (middle of the Meatpacking District, directly on the High Line, next door to the Whitney, close proximity to West Village and Chelsea design, etc., etc.). The rooms are well designed and very comfortable with beautiful views regardless of what side of the hotel you are on. Lastly, the staff is amazing, especially Kevin Chong at the front desk. He is incredibly helpful & friendly.

So, a birthday dinner went long (really long), and as a last minute birthday surprise, I said "have you ever stayed at The Standard at The Highline??" He hadn't, and I knew that we would want to sleep in and also enjoy the experience of the ridiculous views that the Amazing Front Desk Staff afforded us at, literally, the last minute.The room was absolutely perfect, and Dave made sure we were on the highest floor, and got one of their infamous 4.5-foot-deep soaking tubs.I woke up way earlier than he did, since, well, I've got work to do and the room is perfect for both him sleeping off a few too many martinis while I get to my emails and my work deadlines before our generous late check out (thank you so much for that!
